The MIT Enterprise Forum of New York City is a volunteer, not-for-profit organization part of a network of 27 chapters worldwide. Our mission is to be the New York City-based leader in hosting networking and educational events focused on innovation and entrepreneurship.

We host monthly events that attract between 30 and 200+ people. We count a membership of 200 people and a subscription list of 10,000 people, and have been an active chapter since 1971. We also occasionally host events with partner organizations. Our constituency is made up of local entrepreneurs, business leaders, technologists, venture capitalists, angel investors, other financiers and service providers. A fraction of our participants are alumni of MIT although our organization and events are open to all.

Our events mainly focus on the following verticals:

  • Technology Entrepreneurship
  • Media & Information Technology
  • Clean and Renewable Technology
  • Biotechnology and Healthcare Information
  • Venture Capital Roundtables & Business Plan

Disclaimer: The MIT Enterprise Forum name must not be used in ways that suggest or imply the endorsement of other organizations, their products, or their services. The use of the Forum's name, logo, seal, and photographs in the advertising and other promotional material and activities of outside organizations is prohibited when such use is likely to be understood as an endorsement, even if such an endorsement is not the intention of the person or organization seeking to use MIT's name. All proposals, therefore, for the use of MIT's name or other identification in advertising, sales literature and videos, and commercial publicity must be submitted to info@mitef-nyc.org.

Furthermore, the announcements made within this Meetup.com group are neither monitored nor endorsed by the MIT Enterprise Forum. As such, all content within this Group should not be recognized as an official announcement of the forum, unless publicized by the Meetup group's managers.

results.description:
see http://2664.toastmastersclubs.org/ for the club's website.

The Clifton Toastmasters Club is a part of Toastmasters International.  Our club has about 30 members.  Members are all levels from beginning speaker to advanced. A membership application and fee must be submitted to become a club member (see below).

"Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Today, our membership is 260,000 strong. These members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 12,500-plus clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.

How Does It Work?

  • A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. A typical group has 20 to 40 members who meet weekly, biweekly or monthly. A typical meeting lasts 60 – 90 minutes.
  • There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure."

Why should I join?
The Toastmasters program offers many benefits that help people in all walks of life. As a result of participating in Toastmasters, you will:

  • Increase your self-confidence
  • Become a better speaker
  • Become a better leader
  • Communicate more effectively

Membership is affordable – a great value that can change your life that costs less than a dollar a day. Your initial investment:

  • $20 New member fee
  • $42 Dues for six months, plus any club expenses. (Some clubs may charge a nominal fee in addition to the regular dues for items such as meeting space and club supplies.)

More than 4 million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

 

"All rights reserved. Toastmasters International, the Toastmasters International logo and all other Toastmasters International trademarks and copyrights are the sole property of Toastmasters International and may be used only by permission. "
results.name: Clifton Toastmasters Club

results.description:
What is "The Art of Active Networking" and why do we do it?  Well we started this in San Francisco in 2009 to show people how to do better and to truly build powerful, meaningful, collaborative business and personal relationships.

There was a recent article suggesting this staggering statistic: “Given the opportunity, over 70 percent of ALL people are not happy with their job, career or with what they are doing…and given the opportunity would change it!” Seems like a whole lot of people who do not love what they do when they wake up in the morning.

With so many people unhappy, searching for jobs, shifting jobs, building their business, practice or consultancy and wanting more from life or wanting help following their passion, this event brings an amazing cross section of people. Thousands of CEO's, CFO’s, Tech Folks, Entrepreneur's, Chefs, Wine Makers, Retail and Gallery Owners, Models, Photographers, Art Director's, Designers, Actors, Musicians, Real Estate Executives, Corporate Trainers, Coaches, Therapists, Publicists, Financial Folks including Investors and Venture Capitalists, and Singles, have attended, in fact nearly every type of person has attended.

At our events worldwide, people are finding jobs, leaving jobs to follow their dreams, getting dates, creating new ideas, investing in each other getting roommates, clients, connections and discovering a new way to think! Best of all they are implementing what they learn here at "The Art of Active Networking" and frankly, it's making their conversation so much easier when they hit the streets and move forward in life.

Mark E. Sackett, the creator of "The Art of Active Networking", lives in New York, San Francisco and Los Angeles and visits Vancouver 6-8 times a year and does his events in these cities monthly or bi-monthly! He is a well known speaker, art director, director and producer for Advertising, Branding, Film, Music and Television. He has 13 related businesses and a powerfully Active Network.

Mark created The Art of Active Networking through one of his businesses, Brainfood Creative Programs; with the sole purpose of helping people do better. This is the most unique and connected Networking event and group you will be a part of this year!

Our sole purpose is to help people do better in this ever changing economy, and to work through life shifts, while meeting in a unique new way, people they would otherwise not connect with. We’ve had 10's of Thousands of people have attended our "The Art of Active Networking" events and they love it.

This is NOT one of those throw your business card at someone and try to sell yourself events; instead, we ask one important question: "How can I help you do better right now?" Helping people and businesses do better right now is all that ultimately matters. And at the event, I will tell you why and how you can do it better! At "The Art of Active Networking", I teach people how to look at building stronger, deeper, more passionate connections in business, life and love. We discuss how to use social media and your relationships to your advantage and why that should be just a small part of your overall plan, and finally I talk about developing your own "personal brand", no matter what it is you do or want to accomplish.

We have a load of fun doing it! This is not a boring seminar, a dry talk or an event full of superficial conversations. You will meet cool, connected and interesting people in a small intimate setting monthly! And often you will be treated to a live concert or performance by one of our many talented friends.
results.name: The Art of Active Networking-NYC presented by Mark E Sackett

results.description:
Founded by Director and Passionate Makeup Artist Amy Nicole, CHICSTUDIOS NYC – School of Makeup Artistry opened its doors in New York City in 2009 as a professional school that educates aspiring and established artists. CHICSTUDIOS is best known for its one-of-a-kind 4-Week Professional Makeup Artistry Course that is carefully designed to teach the fundamentals and techniques of makeup artistry. The school boasts an array of award-winning instructors, intense and comprehensive curriculums and offers lasting relationships with the CHICSTUDIOS Community.

Our Mission Statement

CHICSTUDIOS NYC - School of Makeup Artistry is dedicated to providing our aspiring artists with the techniques and skills needed to succeed in the industry of makeup artistry, as well as creative, hands-on training, helpful career guidance and an extended invite into the CHICSTUDIOS Community.


Values

At CHICSTUDIOS NYC – School of Makeup Artistry we believe in makeup as a true art and an ultimate passion that is embedded in every artist, hidden until inspired and then ready to be cultivated. We believe in intimate class settings with no more than ten students per instructor to ensure the best experience possible. And perhaps most importantly, we believe in our students and their ability to grow and succeed in the world of professional makeup artistry.

Why Choose CHICSTUDIOS?

First and foremost, our students and alumni receive the ultimate CHIC Treatment. Our experienced instructors and friendly staff offer our students a comprehensive, hands-on curriculum taught exclusively in intimate class settings and a studio environment. Our course kits consist of top-brand cosmetics, including MAC, Make Up For Ever, Smashbox to name a few. Upon enrollment, all students become a lasting member of the CHICSTUDIOSCommunity – a group of professional makeup artists with access to exclusive alumni events, makeup discounts, career counseling and up-to-date notifications of freelance opportunities.

 

Secondly, CHICSTUDIOSis the ONLY makeup artistry learning school of its kind. Unlike a cosmetology school, our 4-Week program allows students to focus solely on the fundamentals and techniques of makeup artistry. During the final 14 hours of the program, students can study a specific concentration, such as TV & Music Video Makeup, Period Makeup (1920s-Present) and Fashion & Runway Makeup. Upon completion of the program, students receive a “Certificate of Professional Makeup Artistry” and have an opportunity to participate in a professional photo shoot to begin their portfolios.
results.name: CHICSTUDIOS NYC - SCHOOL OF MAKEUP ARTISTRY!

results.description:
Welcome to NYC Mobile!

This group is for folks doing interesting things in the mobile space. The goal is to inspire mobile innovation in New York City through thought exchange and networking.

We love the perspectives of technologists, strategists, business innovators, marketers and advertisers.

Important topics to discuss include ad networks, payment systems, mobile UI, 2D codes, app development, mobile hardware and software, platform opportunities/growth and how legacy industries are evolving through mobile.

We meet monthly. In addition to networking, we like demos and panels. Please be in touch if you are interested in doing a demo.

Look for updates via email and on this site. See you soon!

 

Amanda Moskowitz

armoskowitz@gmail.com

organizer, NYC Mobile

topics.name: Growing in Intimacy with Jesus Christ
Bible Study in a Relaxed Atmosphere
A Christian Cafe Open to All

results.description:
We decided to start this group to offer a safe place for people to meet, relax in a quiet atmosphere free from finger pointing and simply to love a God who is and always has been in love with each of us.

We share God's Word in an open and refreshing way. If you love people are open to everyone's ideas and willing to accept others the way God accepts each of us and willing to grow, this group is for you.

In recent years, I have taken studies in pastoral counseling and pastoral care, and have learned that people grow as they meet in community, sharing ideas with others who listen and support their various journey's, and in a respectful manner, share the teaching's of Jesus Christ, as clearly taught by the Apostles and disciples in the homes of first-century believers.

Come with something to share, a song to sing, your favorite Bible text or story,
an instrument to play or a poem to read.

We talk, pray, discuss the issues of the day and how they relate to our lives and share God's love. All we need is you.

We currently meet on Saturday mornings at The Chapel At Union Square, a place we rent at The Seafarers International House, 123 East 15th Street, NYC, on the corner of Irving Place, in the Union Square area of New York City, between Third Ave. and Irving Place.

Look for our sign in the window: The Chapel At Union Square.

Depending on how large the group is that day, you will find us as you enter the lobby of the building, by taking the stairs or the elevator to the Mezzanine level (Press "M" in the elevator) and make a right to the small conference room.

If our group is large, we will be meeting in the small chapel just to the right as you enter the lobby of the building.

If you have a special prayer request, come and share it here and we will pray for you and with you. This is a safe place where all are welcome no matter what your faith tradition or if you have no faith tradition at all.

"Humble yourselves, therefore, under God's mighty hand, that He may lift you up in due time. Cast all your anxiety on Him, because He cares for you."
1 Peter 5:6-7

We look forward to meeting you at The Chapel At Union Square, Saturday mornings at 10:00 a.m.

May God bless you today, and give you peace and a calm spirit.

Best regards - Tony Romeo
results.name: Cafe Reach Bible Study Group

results.description:
Welcome to South Slope Social! We like the three S's in the name, but we're pretty flexible with the neighborhood boundaries if you have something you'd like to get together for!

The dance card is wide open. If you join us, you can feel free to schedule a Meetup at your favorite place *and* at your preferred time to be social too.

For those in the know, this neighborhood is home to some pretty amazing drinking holes, dive bars, music venues, film fun, cocktail paradises + fabulous food.

Join our Meetup Group to savor them all, share your favorites, make new friends + meet your neighbors.
results.name: South Slope Social

results.description:
Our Mission as a group is to encourage a sense of community and provide a network of support to mothers by other mothers. We do this by connecting local moms through various meet ups so they can exchange information, find out about local resources, ask for advice and support from one another. Our casual and convenient meet-ups make for an intimate and respectful environment enabling mothers to develop long lasting friendships.

No matter how many books and tips expecting moms may read, nothing fully prepares a new mom for the reality of motherhood. Motherhood is wonderful, but it is also tough — full of long nights, lonely days, lots of questions and endless amounts of laundry! From figuring out which diaper or baby food brand is best, to an easy place to have lunch with your tot in tow, to the best spa for some much needed (and rare) mommy time, moms need a network. Hoboken Moms provide moms with an instant community and local resources to make life as a family convenient, efficient and above all FUN!

Whether you’re a new or seasoned mom, a working or stay at home mom, Hoboken Moms is the place for you. Our meet-ups range from casual ‘drop in’ playgroups, to larger family events, to moms night out-no kids allowed! Hoboken Moms strives to build long lasting relationships between moms and children that extend past our meet ups.

If you have free time please consider volunteering to host a playgroup. It could be as simple as inviting other Hoboken Moms to join you during your morning coffee at the local coffee shop or on your afternoon stroll in one of the many Hoboken parks. It's a great way to get to know other mothers and find your little one a playmate!

https://www.facebook.com/hobokenmomsmeetup

https://www.facebook.com/groups/337391102965546/
results.name: The Hoboken Moms Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to NYC GRINDHOUSE - the only group on Meetup.com that deals specifically with the Exploitation Film Genre. We'll be watching old classics such as Russ Meyer's 'Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!' and Jack Hill's 'Coffy', the film that launched sexy Pam Grier into the spotlight, as well as new Grindies like Tarantino's 'Death Proof' and my recent favorite, 'MACHETE'!

When summer comes, we'll take a few weekend road-trips to check out the few remaining DRIVE-INs in NY - the closest one is less than 2 hours drive from Midtown, Madhattan! As well, I'll be hosting 'Drive-In Double Features' on my rooftop in gritty Hell's Kitchen. If you have any questions, please email me at Grindmaster@NYCGrindhouse.com, or call/text me @ (347) 523-3937.



We'll also be checking out special Midnight Screenings @ the famous Sunshine theatre on East Houston Street, as well as other exploitation screenings in and around Badhattan.



FINALLY, as the original 'Grindhouses' were named after the now defunct burlesque theaters located on 42nd Street in New York City, where 'bump n' grind' dancing and striptease were featured, we'll visit some of the remaining burlesque and vaudeville venues in NYC for a bit of naughtiness. . .



Check out Ed Barnas's BURLESQUE CALENDAR!

 


 

Feel free to contact us at Grindmaster@NYCGrindhouse.com / (347) 523-3937!

 


https://vimeo.com/user2595810/bddtitlesequence#t=1s

results.description:
People in New York always seem to say, "This is a tough city in which to meet people." This group was designed to make it a whole lot easier. Drinking with Strangers is about bringing people together, whether new to the area or native, and meeting up at a local bar, restaurant, or event without the formalities associated with the usual scene.

Drinking with Strangers is a place where friendly people can come out and enjoy good company with other easy-going, receptive people for drinks, eats, socializing, and making new friends.

Drinking with Strangers is free to join, and is currently a work in progress. Any suggestions or ideas are appreciated. We'll try to keep the rules to a minimum. I do have one:

Don't create an awkward environment for others. Members who are not respectful and friendly towards others will be removed from the group.

Thanks for joining; I look forward to meeting you at the next event!
results.name: Drinking with Strangers - New York

results.description:
In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small and community oriented so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome.

Each meeting is divided into two parts: the first is dedicated to discussion and interchange from Silo's Message and the second part to internal experience. We work with guided experiences that focus on Well-Being for ourselves and others and an experience which is focused on quieting the mind and awakening the internal energy, known as the Force.

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection (see our sister meetup group http://www.meetup.com/Spirituality-Nature-Meetup-Day-trips-out-of-NYC/). The Park is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211
results.name: New York Meditation group Union Square based on The Message

It's a fun, social time that you and your baby will look forward to every week! Moderator: Julie Thompson, highly intuitive and extremely well-liked, she holds a masters in social work and has 2 children of her own as well as being a past client of Postpartum Place.

results.description:
Here's your big chance to venture out with your baby and give the mom a much needed break!  User-friendly, baby-friendly place to hang out while she goes and does whatever she wants for an hour or so.

That's right!  After several years,  I bet you can guess it's pretty popular by now.  In the past we've had Dad's with babies as young as 7 days and as old as 1 year join us. We've had crawlers and cruisers and twins and premies.  We are fully equipped with changing tables, comfortable couches  etc

Coffee and bagels on the house!

Hosted by one of our PPP Dads, Antonio Fuster

As a graduate from Long Island University, he holds a Dual BS in Criminal Justice and Psychology.  He started his career as a behavioral counselor as well as Drug and Alcohol rehabilitation specialist, while simultaneously working in the fitness industry.  With the birth of his son in 2011 Antonio has changed careers to focus on Holistic Health and Fitness, primarily prenatal and postpartum fitness for both Mom and Dad.

Antonio is a strong believer in Intuitive Parenting, which is a “follow your heart” philosophy that creates a safe, nurturing environment facilitating growth for both parent and child.

results.description: This group is a group aimed to empower parents of special needs children. We will aim to eventually become a non-profit organization and get funding and grants to be able to give our members salaries. Funding will be available to provide needed resources for our children. Our interests are helping the parents to survive stress, emotional burnout, financial burnout, to empower them to fight for their children in educational, health and social settings. To lift the parents out of despair and desperation and to rise up out of the ashes into a great and happy productful and healthy life. All aspects of being a caregiver will be addressed. Parents have needs and when a child is disabled and needs a parent 24/7 we have to be able to rescue the parent/family so they can function and be happy again. Please bring your ideas and children -my condo is big and welcome to all. Tea/coffee will be served with snacks. We want your stories and we want to empower you to begin to live again and be positive!!!!
results.name: Parents of Miraculous and Special Children

Immodest Proposals is also a group for the appreciation of good wine, beer, and food. We select venues with affordable, sustainable options and then arrange for our members to get deals on their offerings during the meeting.

The typical member of Immodest Proposals is atypical. We take everyone.

topics.name: Eckhart Tolle The Power of Now
Getting to the Bottom of our Troubles
Using EFT to Reduce Pain and Trauma

results.description:
This group is intended to create community for adults who want to share their thoughts and feelings about life challenges in a supportive and consciously aware small group setting. We explore the notion of 'Emotional Freedom' and introduce ideas about healing, mindfulness, and spirituality that can help us live more fulfilling lives.

The essential question is, "what does the idea of emotional freedom mean to you?"

“Emotional Overwhelm” can prevent us from effectively meeting challenges, accepting change and moving ahead. Thoughts about difficult situations and past events can trigger negative emotions that keep us stuck. EMOTIONAL FREEDOM TECHNIQUES (EFT), which is based on the emerging field of Energy Psychology, can quickly and effectively address any kind of negative emotion that keeps you from enjoying a greater life experience. In EFT, you learn to tap on specific body trigger points to correct the energy disruptions that cause unwanted emotions (like using psychological acupuncture). Come learn this easy and effective approach to self healing and together we’ll tap our way to more emotional freedom and well being.

The facilitator for these meetings is Steven Gottlieb, a personal performance and empowerment coach and a specialist in the emerging fields of Energy Psychology and Energy Medicine. He conducts workshops and personal consultations that have helped hundreds of people to overcome obstacles to experiencing a healthier and more joyful life. He passionately shares his knowledge of cutting edge healing techniques and offers these from a heart centered approach. (Learn more about Steve at www.stevenghealing.com)

Meetings will be held periodically at various locations to be announced in and around the lower Westchester County, NY area. Please contact us if you have suitable meeting place available and would like to host a meeting.

Attendees are requested to be mindful at all times of their own personal emotional well being and the care and support of others in the group. If you have concerns about your own ability to remain emotionally and psychologically well in a group where deep life issues are being addressed we urge you to seek professional medical or psychological care. The group facilitators, while experienced healers and coaches, are not acting as licensed healthcare professionals and cannot be responsible for your personal care in a meetup group setting.
results.name: Emotional Freedom Discussion and Healing Group, White Plains

topics.name: Small Business Strategies and Networking for Women

results.description:
If you are a dynamic woman in the NJ area and looking for a fresh, new Women's Group, then, join us for out next gathering. Sue Waldman is committed to bringing women together to exchange ideas, support aspirations, share stories & work collectively on meaningful projects. The Women's meetup is an opportunity for Women to come together and help one another. We all have a purpose and something to give to the world.

Perhaps you have always wanted to start your own business? Maybe you want to expand the one you already own or transition to something new? Do you feel isolated and desire to have a support network? Do you need to get some respite from your business and simple have "ME" time?

This group will leave you feeling inspired, connected and supported to live your life more fully.

Women to Women offers various opportunities for women to connect with each other, support your dreams and help one another with business, a hobby or something you want to achieve.  We will network, share our stories and simply, have fun!

The Women's meetup is facilitated by Sue Waldman who is a licensed psychotherapist and Inspirational Life Coach who specializes in Women and transformation!

In 2005, Sue created the Wellness Networking Group ~ a community of professionals who serve humanity by making a difference in people's lives by spreading hope, faith and love. She conceived of the idea to promote a spirit of cooperation vs. competition in the wellness industry as a way of uniting professionals and consumers around a cooperative, supportive community dynamic. Sue will also create meet ups that sponsor her Living, Loving and Learning seminar series where outside guest speakers present inspirational classes. They are like customized adult school classes but in a more intimate setting. Three years ago, Sue Waldman started Rose Business Consulting, LLC where she helps self-employed individuals develop, market and promote their businesses.

In addition to offering private counseling and coaching sessions, Sue  also hosts weekly workshops to bring the community together, to educate about wellness and lifestyle changes and to provide a peaceful place to make new friends.

The Women's meetup is all about connecting with like-minded women to learn, to share, and to discuss personal, spiritual and professional issues in a safe, sacred space to get support and empowerment from one another.

Remember ~ Each and Every day is a new Beginning and "Anything is Possible!".

For more information, contact:

Sue Waldman

Advanced Counseling & Coaching Services
320A Bloomfield ave
Verona, New Jersey 07044


Please feel free to contact Sue at (973) 857-9090 and visit her website at http://www.SueWaldman.com


*** There is a membership fee of $10.00 which will help cover operating costs and organizing efforts of  The Women's Meetup***
results.name: The Women's Meetup

results.description:
Maria Alexandra Bella is a registered dietitian and the founder of Top Balance nutrition located in New York City. Maria started her career in nutrition with a weight loss of over 70 lbs that she has been able to maintain since 2006.

Her own experience that that of many of her patients allowed Maria to understand the importance of accountability, ongoing support as well as the most reliable and up-to-date information in order to achieve lasting weight loss.

Our weekly weight loss support group is dedicated to helping you overcome any obstacles and roadblocks standing between you and your dreams.

Our meetings start with a weekly OPTIONAL weigh-in. Some enjoy the accountability of the scale, whereas other prefer to focus on the overall health instead of the numbers. Both approaches work well with us.

We then proceed to discuss the topic of the week. Our fun and interactive discussions include food groups, foods that boost up the metabolism, busting nutrition myths, supermarket shopping tips, snacking ideas, recipe swaps, meal timing for exercise, intuitive eating principles, and much more.

In addition to the multitute of nutrition topics, we also invite regular guest speakers including successful weight losers, psychotherapists, exercise specialists, and healthy chefs.

Each meeting lasts 60-90 minutes and is capped to 15 people in order to accomodate ample individual attention and provide an opportunity for a stimulating and fun group discussion.

Please call 212.444.8053 any time between 7 am and 8 pm Monday-Friday or 9 am and 6 pm on Saturdays if you have any further questions regarding our meetings.

We look forward to seeing you soon!!!
results.name: Registered Dietitian Weekly Weight Loss Support Group

results.description:
NYC Fashion Bloggers Meetup Group was started because there was a need for this group. New York City is the Fashion Capital of America and needs fashionable and witty bloggers to represent it.
There is a need for bloggers to network, socialize and get to know one another and Meetup is a great place to get started. This group is for all the fashion bloggers of New York City (all boroughs). If you are a fashion/lifestyle blogger based in NYC this meetup group is for you! We are planning tons of meetups at great venues and have plans for major blogger events.

For Membership Consideration:

Must have been blogging for 4 Months+

Must actually have a FASHION blog

Must apply with a meetup group photo

Must fill out the questions in Full

Must include a link to your blog

For professional reasons we do NOT accept members who are owners/founders of PR Firms, Social Media and Marketing Firms and the like but we do work/collaborate with people in those positions.

Thanks so much for your interest!
results.name: NYC Fashion Bloggers Meetup Group

results.description:
All are welcome!

The price of membership is participation!

I created this group for the purpose of meeting and socializing with new people. I hope to create an environment where everyone can have a good time, and hopefully create new friendships.

You have not join a dating site but if you make a connection with someone, keep it classy.  You have not join a business networking group, so this may not be the best group to market your business but feel free to give out your business card or use your profile. You have not join an events notice website but more of a club, where you are expected to come out, meet and socialize with the other members. 

The purpose of this group is to socialize, to create some fun memories, to make a friend or two and to get you out of the house!

The meetups will consist of various activities: going out to clubs, and lounges, visiting museums, experiencing the various cultural activities of the city and trying new things.

By attending Caribbean Social Network events, you are assuming responsibility for your own safety.  Everyone should drink responsibly; and please make sure that you are physically able to attend the various events.

**We all have busy live and I don't expect any member to come to all the events but at a minimum, visit the group web site at least once every three month to show continued interest and when your schedule permits, come out to one of the event.  If I have not met you at one of the event after a period of time of you joining the group, I will assume lack of interest and remove you from the group.  If after I have met you at one of the event and you have been inactive for 6 month (not visiting the group web site) again I will assume lack of interest and remove you from the group.**

(PLEASE POST A PHOTO)

results.description:
You spend your days being serious, responsible, professional. Maybe you have a stressful job, have bills to pay, have people who depend on you. BEING A GROWN-UP IS HARD WORK!! Every now and then, we need a play date - whether it be for just an hour or evening - to reconnect and relax.

"There's power in looking silly and not caring that you do." -- Amy Poehler

SILLY DATE! NEW YORK is a good clean fun Meetup group in New York City for singles and their friends. Members are fun, friendly, independent and are interested in getting together to meet new people, make new friends, try different things, share some laughs, and cut loose in a laid-back and supportive environment.

There is no typical meetup. Our volunteer organizers post meetups based on their individual interests, but members can submit event ideas too.

Some past/sample events:

MUSEUMS (Geek Day; American Museum of Natural History, MOMA, New Museum, Morgan Museum, Museum of Moving Image, Brooklyn Museum) * STANDUP / IMPROV COMEDY (Whiplash/ PIT, ASSSSCAT 3000/ Upright Citizens Brigade, Laughing Devil, Chopschtick; Joe Wong, Steve Hofstetter; Daniel Kitson) * MOVIES/FILMS (Veronica Mars, The Muppets, Harold & Kumar, Studio Ghibli / Miyazaki, Jiro Dreams of Sushi; RiverFlicks, Tribeca Film Festival; IFC, Landmark Sunshine, Angelica, Film Forum) * PICNICS (Central Park, Roosevelt Island, Highline) * THEATER AND PERFORMANCE (Broadway, The Heiress, Once the Musical, Here Lies Love, National Theatre Live / NT Live, Drum Corps International / DCI, Shakespeare in the Park, The Moth, Puppet Playlist, Fringe Festival/ FringeNYC, The Secret City; St. Ann's Warehouse, Barrow Street Theater, Public Theater, BAM, NYU Skirball, Symphony Space) * DANCING (Contra Dance, Barn Dance, Hula Dance) * SINGING (Greenwich Village Caroling Walk, Grace Church Choral Society, West Village Chorale, Karaoke) * LIVE MUSIC (Bell House, Jalopy, Rockwood Music Hall) * FOOD (Cheap Eats, Ethnic Eats, Food Trucks, IKEA, Fine Dining; Vanessa's Dumplings, Nam Pang, Marumi, Gyu Kaku BBQ, Grand Sichuan, Szechuan Gourmet, Taste of Persia, Modern Bar Room @ MOMA) * CREATIVE (Puppet Kitchen) * OUTDOORS (Central Park Ice Skating, Manhattan Wonderwalk, The Great Saunter; High Line, Brooklyn Botanical Garden, Snug Harbor) * LOCAL FESTIVALS AND EVENTS (Japan Day, Cherry Blossom Festival, Jazz Age Lawn Party, Union Square Holiday Market, Brooklyn Night Bazaar, Coney Island Mermaid Parade) * TRAVEL/ DAY TRIPS (Beacon NY, Cold Spring NY, Ridgewood NJ; Governor's Island, Staten Island)

Events start with a rough plan, but once attendees arrive.... we improvise!

Sounds good?

JOIN AS MEMBER! To be a member, please submit a representative photo and tell us a little about your work/play/ shy/outgoing/ introvert/extrovert self and any silly/serious /quirky/geeky interests. Every new member is a future friend so we want to get to know you!

ATTEND A MEETUP! Check out our event calendar. Events with an 'EVENT HOST' are confirmed and someone has volunteered to be an Event Host i.e. contact point to manage communications and greet attendees. Events with a 'FYI ONLY' or 'TENTATIVE' are suggested on a "see ya there, maybe" basis until someone steps up as Event Host.

SUGGEST AN EVENT! Have an event you are planning to attend and looking for others to join you? Suggest it and offer to 'host' it! Being an Event Host is easier than it sounds and a great way to support groups, organizations, interests you care about, as well as a great way to meet more people and make new friends.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

MEMBER STUFF:

Members must be 21 years of age.

To foster friendly and supportive "non-scene" singles-friendly community, members agree to be respectful of each other. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated. Bad behavior is reason for removal from group and includes:1) disparaging comments concerning age, race, sexual orientation, religion, politics, economic situation, 2) overtly sexual or aggressive advances toward another member, 3) expressions of extreme indecency, hatred, pornography, fetishism, criminality via group website, email, in person.

Members agree to be considerate and courteous to Event Hosts, who agree to lead on a non-paid volunteer basis. RSVPs of "Yes" should be honored. Same-day no-shows will not be tolerated and is reason for removal from group. Lateness and cancellations should be communicated to Event Host.

Members agree to participate in events at their own risk and will not hold Group Organizer(s) or Event Host(s) responsible for any incidents or damages.

To keep the group diverse and events as relaxed as possible, there is intentionally no fee to join and to RSVP, except when there is venue charge eg. museum admission, movie ticket, etc. However, should you enjoy your experience, please consider helping to defray our fixed Meetup costs (currently $144/yr) by using our Sponsors links when making purchases.

results.description:
Something that all dogs need: Exercise, Walks & Mental Stimulation!!

Pooky's club was originally established in 2003 as a "cockers" only meetup. I created it to exercise & socialize my "reactive" dog around other dogs & to meet other cocker owners in the area who love the breed as much as I do. Soon thereafter, people started contacting me saying that they didnt have a cocker, but could they come pleazzzze? So effective 2006 I changed it to Pooky's All Breed Dog Walking Club!

All breeds & ages are welcome! The club has grown by leaps & bounds!  We meet at various local parks in northern NJ when the weather is nice. We Walk, Hike, hold Yappy Hours, go to the Beach, have Ice Cream Socials, Birthday Parties, go on Field trips & much more!

Your dog should be friendly with other dogs however reactive dogs are welcome. If your dog is reactive, you are encouraged to come & I will help you work through it. Plus the dogs go home tired! A tired dog is a good dog. Hey we all can use a little exercise! This is a leashed all breed exercise & socialization walk for dogs & their humans. Get Fit with Fido! We've met some great people, some great dogs & made new friends! Your dog should be leashed & up to date on shots. Please bring water & poop bags. Training tips are also offered. Treats are recommended to reward good behavior.

results.description:
Every PR professional I know wants to use their talents to perform important socially needed, cause-based activities. Especially now, during these extremely difficult economic times, thousands of important charitable programs will begin to fail. Remarkably, the power of PR can help many of these organizations to begin to prosper again.

This marks the creation of the PublicRelationsCares.org national meetup organization, the first all volunteer/intern organization for socially responsible PR professionals and students.

The purpose of this meetup is to begin to develop a social responsibility internship program for the tens of thousands of amazing public relations professionals and students majoring in public relations at respected universities nationally.

Our members will be drawn from the professional public relations industry and from university communications/PR departments. This will provide students with real-world, hands-on experiences and will give them the opportunity to do feel-good work with “seasoned” PR professionals while gaining valuable insight into social responsibility as well as developing on-the job skills that will be needed throughout their professional careers.

results.description:
Sunday Meditation group will meet
(30 min. Toning*, 30 minutes of Silence)

I look forward to meeting you. My husband and I began meditating and toning together 13 years ago and, at the start of the New Year, I felt prompted to start a group in my Brooklyn home. We had our first meeting and it was fantastic. I introduced toning and, for those with no experience, I very briefly discussed some helpful, beginning meditation techniques. These sessions are primarily experiential roughly 30 min. toning and 30 min. meditating.
Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.
Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

Offering: Give whatever you want or nothing at all.
Time: Every other Sunday 7-8:15 (please arrive on time)
Place: Clinton Hill/Bed Stuy (e-mail for address)-G train-Bedford/Nostrand

http://www.AlexanderTechniqueBrooklyn.com

We have a second meetup called Sound Journey, http://www.meetup.com/Sound-Journey/

results.description:
The Academy of European Arts and Culture ~ Long Island is a dedicated group of seekers who are committed to the process of Awakening the Soul.  Based upon the work of philosophers, artists, mystics, theologians and scientists throughout the centuries, each has left a legacy that offers one the practical tools to live an enriched life.

During our meetings we discuss different topics related to the Awakening process, with a special emphasis on learning how to observe the parts of us that create obstacles to being present. We also study great men and woman throughout history who have awakened and left behind the gems of their process in various forms.  Some of these souls include: Walt Whitman, Leonardo Da Vinci, Hildegard Von Bingen, William Shakespeare, George Gurdjieff, P.D. Ouspensky, Buddha, Rumi, Hafiz, St. Teresa de Avila, Rene Maria Rilke and Mervyn Brady to name a few.

The Academy creates an environment of study and verification through experience of awakening the soul and higher consciousness in order to live  a life of balance and harmony in body, soul and spirit. The main effort in meetings is to achieve the silence and inner peace that is inherent within the Present moment. All true traditions and paths are connected in this desire and are welcome.

We look forward to seeing you!

results.description:
The NYC Junto is a monthly meeting focused on free markets, Objectivism, and investing. It was founded in 1985 by investor Victor Niederhoffer, who hosts each meeting. More info on the NYC is available at NYCJunto.org. More info on Niederhoffer is available at his website DailySpeculations. Niederhoffer tweets at twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer.

The NYC Junto is inspired by the Junto hosted by Benjamin Franklin in Philadelphia from 1727 to 1757. Like Franklin, we bring together intelligent people to discuss intellectual issues in a respectful manner.

Our meetings are always held at the Mechanics Institute at at 20 W 44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues in Manhattan on the first Thursday of each month. We usually have a guest speaker who can bring new insights and ideas to us. Debate and questions are encouraged. Admission is free. No donation is requested. There is no connection with any political party or religious organization.

Why I started the group:

I read in Benjamin Franklin's autobiography that the most valuable thing he ever did in his life was to have a series of meetings with a dozen of his friends where they would try to make contributions to natural philosophy as well as their individual welfare.

I always had tremendous respect for Doug Casey of the Eris group and I tried to model a group halfway between the Eris Society and the kind of group that Benjamin Franklin had. I invited people interested in free markets and the idea was to have one paper from the point of view of liberty to give us something hard to bite into and then discuss it and have a lot of feedback. And it has spontaneously grown.

We have it once a month, almost always on the first Thursday. It used to be at my office in New York until they chased me out of New York with their excessive taxation.

We started out by trying a few different formats but we coalesced on a format that works. We have about an hour where members unload various things about liberty in the news that they have a particular insight into. Then we have an invited speaker who talks about his own work on the forefront of individualism or liberty, and then we have a very animated discussion and feedback.

In our group, we have experts on almost every subject. The speakers always tell us that it's one of the most dynamic experiences for them. People write to me from all over the U.S. that they love my Junto, that it is one of the highlights of their life, that they hate to move out of New York, and that they will never be able to find anything like it.

I finance it and pay for the speakers.

Almost every major free market and individualist speaker has spoken at our group, and it has been going for almost 30 years.

All are welcome.

Victor Niederhoffer
results.name: NYC Junto

We are poets and short story writers, web designers and database developers, startup founders, essayists, investors, and six-word novelists. You are too. Come have a word with us.

Success in business depends on your knowledge, skills, networks and personal relationships. We will host presentations and workshops offered by members as well as networking and social events where you will have the opportunity to meet others from different industries and professions to discuss relevant current events and share experiences, business ideas, strategies and opportunities.

results.description:
I started this group because I love to camp. I like to be out in the fresh air and get together with friends and enjoy the sites and smells of the woods. I have found it difficult to find people that are interested in mini week-end camp trips and that is alot of what my job enables me to be able to do, so I decided to start my own meet-up group...lets go camping and get out of the city!
Welcome everyone! I work hard to ensure that there are different activities at each camping trip that you can choose to visit. Come out and have some fun, I am really excited about this camping season! You can choose to do as many or as few activities as you like.
I plan local camping trips that are within 1-2 hours of New Rochelle/Bronx area and as I spend alot of time researching for the lowest cost campgrounds and/or getting us discount group rates you will be able to save money! And I make sure that there are activities in the area! Note, although I appreciate that everyone has their favorite sites camp grounds...it is next to impossible to get more than two people to sign up for a campground that is more than 1 and 1/2 hours away from New Rochelle New York...so I almost never post any that are further than that driving range.
If you bring an item YOU should be able to assemble and disassemble anything you bring with NO help! –if you can’t please be considerate and CALL me WAY in advance and lets practice together for the ease of everyone—camping should be easy and relaxing NOT WORK! If you aren’t sitting down within 30 minutes of arrival you have forgotten the most important camping information: LESS IS MORE…You will enjoy the experience MORE if you have LESS!
All New Members are required to post an actual current picture of themselves, which is clearly identifiable for safety reasons. A picture that is far away, your face is hidden by a tree, helmet etc will not be accepted. You will not be accepted to the group with a picture that I can't recognize you when you walk into camp...and if your picture changes before I know you really well then you will be removed from group for the safety of all members.
All members must have a current paypal account, I do not accept cash payments, as I do not want cash at the site, and frankly once I get to the site I am there to relax not deal with who has paid and who hasn't. You must pay the nominal fee to sign up for an event. It unfortunately costs money to keep this site up and running and as I do not charge members monthly or annual membership fees...I have to charge a bit to off set the cost of keeping our site up so we get to keep our pictures and a way to stay in touch..please do note that I do my best to keep costs down!
It is the members responsibility to READ the write up about each camping trip and to book their own site and bring all their own food and beverage! Occasionally we get group sites which is clearly listed in the write up...so be sure to read...if you ask a question that is already in the write up...I will just tell you to "refer to the write up!" lol please it is a lot of work so save me some energy and time and just take your time to read the write up about each event.
.. everyone can do all their cooking at the base camping site that I will always post the number so we can spend time together and enjoy each others company. That does not mean we cook for you or supply food...you have to bring stoves, pots dishes etc...
Note that YOU are responsible for cleaning up anything you use. You make a mess you clean the mess, take something out, then put it back when you are done, so the next person can use it.
..if you cook it you clean it...lets keep it easy...
YOU must provide your own chairs to sit in.---Do NOT sit in other MEMBERS chairs please use common sense if you want a more comfortable chair --Bring one with!!
Pets: although this group LOVES pets it is a camping group and multiple animals often have issues together..just because your dog/cat/rabbit/turtle/bird is gentle and never causes problems does not mean that someone else's pet will react in kind...so the rule is ONE pet ONLY per trip and it is first request gets the YES...must post in the site area AFTER YOU HAVE SIGNED UP AND PAID FOR EVENT. If you show up to the site with a pet that you do not have a email approval from me ..you will be asked to leave the main site, again this is a safety issue. Please be kind and lets make this a great year. In addition, if you bring a pet with you...if you are found to be neglecting your pet, ie not feeding, ignoring, forgetting, losing etc and other members are taking time to fix these issues you will get ONE and only one gentle reminder …after that you will be removed from the group...Crazy Cool Campers are proud PET owners and we take care of our pets!
CHILDREN: New rules as of 2014 all children under the age of 10 must be off the main site or in their tent if it is a group site...by 10 p.m. NO exceptions...please don't ask just understand that some adults want some down time where they won't have to watch their language etc; Please note we have many Crazy Cool Camper Kids...they are all welcome and wanted. These posts are NOT directed at any one child they are merely designed to accommodate within reason as many members comfort levels as possible while still ensuring our Crazy cool Cids have fun too!
...all children 10 to 13 can remain in the main site until 12:00 p.m
results.name: East Coast Tent Crazy Cool Campers

results.description:
The witches of Grailwood Coven follow the movements of earth, moon, sun and stars amidst the steel towers of our huge stone city of New York. This island, surrounded by rivers and salt sea, is one of the hubs of the human world; it could be easy here to forget or ignore the song of the Trees, and the Animal Spirits, and the voices of the Ancestral Past.

But it is our understanding of the grail quest to seek the truth about the mysterious connection between us and all the Cosmos: to understand both intellectually (science) and emotionally (art) the joy of creation and attunement to that creation.

As we perceive that mystical link with all, both manifest and unmanifest, past future and present, of worlds seen and unseen, we must step up to the responsibility of modifying our behavior, to treat with equity and respect all that is in existence. This is the dream of our Craft. This is the work of our Times.

So mote it be.

~~ Silkie O-Ishi, High Priestess of Grailwood Coven

results.description:
A message from Steven and Fu (your newly named organizers).


New York Education Tech Entrepreneurs: we love the spirit in which this meetup was created and its purpose. Kudos to y'all for joining previous organizers Doug and Mary to create a thriving community committed to taking advantage of the technology and content radically transforming the way students and lifelong learners achieve their educational goals.After talking it over with Mary, she realized we shared a vision for bringing together a community to foster innovation and disruption in education, but that she did not have the bandwidth to manage the community.


As such, we'd like to invite you to the Education Idea eXchange meetup to enable the great conversation and community to live on. We've already held two meetups and had over 200 people join in the last two months, and would love to enable the great conversation and community to live on.


Also, if you're working on something and want to get feedback from the community of educators, entrepreneurs, and technologists, sign up to present here. If you have any questions, always feel free to contact Fu or myself. 

Let's keep the momentum going to reimagine the future of school!

Fu and Steven

--
PS: We work for 4.0 Schools, a nonprofit that brings together educators, entrepreneurs and technologists who are reimagining the future of education, one venture at a time. We're bringing 4.0 from New Orleans to New York.

topics.name: How to Declutter Your Home and Life

results.description:
Welcome to our
Free Self-Help Group.

Hoarding can be a really tenacious problem--very difficult  to overcome. This group aims to help us gradually do the daunting work of changing both our habits and the state of our homes.

We are not professionals;  this is an entirely peer-led project. Still, we have come up with a gentle, practical format that has actually helped many of us over time.

To accommodate member schedules, our free weekly meetings are offered twice a week in Midtown Manhattan. Feel free to attend on Monday afternoons or Wednesday evenings.

We have chosen to be a private group in order to protect the anonymity of our members. Upon joining the group, you will learn the exact location of our meetings.

 

 

Our 15 Seconds of Fame

As Meetup.com just celebrated their million NYC members milestone, our own little Meetup group received some recognition. From the many thousands in NYC, our group and only a handful of others were chosen to be spotlighted in the little, 2 minute video release. See: http://blog.meetup.com/thanks-a-million-ny/
results.name: Hoarders-No-More

topics.name: Vegetarians and Vegans & Vegan Vegetarian Activism

results.description:
NYC Vegans is for vegans, vegetarians and aspiring vegans. When we eat together as a group, we eat 100% vegan.

We're the little sister group to our 8,000-member big sibling group, The New York City Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup.

Here is what makes our smaller group unique:

* We've added a distinctly Brooklyn focus to our group. Whether it's picnics in Prospect Park, fireworks in Coney Island, hanging out in beautiful Brooklyn Bridge Park, or going to Brooklyn's amazing vegetarian restaurants, we'll be hosting events in Brooklyn year-round.

* We still love Manhattan. We're going to be painting the town red, as small groups of us go bar-hopping among Manhattan's top bars and lounges.

* Except for a couple of large outdoor events we host in the summer, we'll almost always be doing small events. Our group will continue its tradition of hosting dinners at Manhattan's best small vegan restaurants.

* I love the water. Many of our events will be next to (and on) rivers, bays, lakes, and the Atlantic Ocean.

* Expect to hear music, see plays, attend cultural events, go dancing, go drinking and clubbing, and generally do the unexpected, the exciting, the elegant, the relaxing and the beautiful.

* While this is primarily a social group, we will sometimes engage in vegan activism and animal rights activism.

This group is specifically meant for people who are "socially conscious" and also very nice. We're that friendly "do-gooder" type of vegan. :) We're good-natured and compassionate, AND we like to have a good time. :)

Whether you're interested in our Manhattan vegan restaurant dinners, our outdoor and waterside adventures, our Manhattan nightlife, music, and cultural escapades, or our Brooklyn events, we invite you to join us for any or all of the above. Being vegan only adds to our fun in the cultural and entertainment capital of the world.
results.name: NYC Vegans: Brooklyn + Manhattan Dinners + Outings

topics.name: Alternative Healing of FIBROIDS and Endometriosis

results.description: I started this group for my dedication in helping women with this terrible chronic disease. My journey started over 10 years ago, as I was diagnosed with Uterine Fibroids. I could not believe after seeing 21 doctors that not one doctor had a clue as to how to treat my fibroids without killing my reproductive system. This delay in treatment and being misinformed was leading me to become sicker and sicker as the years went by.... By the time of my surgery, I was almost at deaths door from years of neglect. I have now recovered and learned how to keep my body free of fibroids with the right foods and supplements. This journey has prompted my passion to become a Holistic Health Coach to dedicate my practice to other women who are in my shoes so we can heal our bodies naturally and seek the proper treatments needed.
results.name: Fibroids: A Natural Healing New Jersey & World Wide

Drop-In  :            $20  Come anytime, pay when you come, no future commitment!

   -Can be used several times in one week!
Siblings & Host :  Half off   

In addition to classes & activities, the group will be invaluable when searching for good "finds" & deals for the Upper West Side Jewish mom.  There is even a place to post questions and answers to any mommy/baby questions that you might be having, post good deals for the Jewish NYC mom, post Kosher restaurants, etc.  Please post as often as you would like once you become a member!

An $18 optional annual donation would be GREATLY appreciated and will be used to help pay for hosting the site and for planning future events.  If you choose, you can pay this donation through pay pal as soon as you become a member by clicking Membership Dues on the left side of the site.

results.description:
When the unthinkable happens in your city, are you prepared to survive? Disaster is a subject like taxes or death, no one wants to talk or think about it. This group is NOT about and totally DIFFERENT from alarmism or paranoia. Western cultural is biased against advance preparation outside times of active warfare. "It's preferred and viewed normal for people to avoid disaster safety."  But, Megadisasters have become part of our modern reality. Too many people mistakenly believe there is no preparation for disaster. Others mistakenly believe all they have to do is wait for help after an event. Still others believe nothing will ever happen to them personally and I hope they are right. But when disaster does occur, will a person be a survivor or victim. What will they name the “It Event” when it strikes your city?

It’s your personal right to turn your fears, uncertainty, anxiety, or helplessness into “Survival Confidence.” No one has time to panic, guess or wait for help when Megadisaster strikes. Each person has the power to prepare themselves and family for disasters. Disaster preparedness is Risk Management for your life. A few simple tools, plans, and skills can save your life. This group will cover 25 different types of emergency and disaster events as a new form of self-development. The first meetup will be a Q & A teleconference based on the questions you ask upon joining. All other meetups are fee based clinics and workshops. Don’t wait for the newspaper, radio, or T.V. to tell you how to prepare; they won’t until a disaster is at your front door. Join this meetup group so you can have total peace of mind.
results.name: How To Survive And Prepare For Any Urban Disaster

results.description:
While only a part of Meet Up Groups since 2011, we previously operated via Yahoo Groups since 2007.  We are a Coven run high magick Wiccan group that offers teaching and training. We meet monthly (2nd Tues of each month, 7:30 p.m., General Poor's Tavern, 45 Main Street, Hackensack) to get to know each other. In addition to the monthly meetings, we offer classes in Wicca 101, meditation, tarot card reading, astrology, past life regression, kitchen witchery, etc.  We hold rituals for each Sabbat (which includes the annual Witches Moonlight Masquerade Ball held at Samhain, a charitable dinner dance/costume party to benefit St. Jude Children's Hospital and Four Legs Good, a local animal shelter) and get together for group trips and other activities to get to know each other better, thereby making our rituals truly special.  Our members are diverse and talented and willing to assist you in your spiritual journey by providing tarot card readings, energy healing, past life regression, emotional cord cutting, house blessing/cleansing and many other services.

Once you join our site, please go to the "More" tab above and then to the "Files" tab in the drop down menu where you will find reading material that provides more information on the Coven as well as other information to assist you to integrate into our group.

This group is open ONLY TO THOSE 21 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER. This age requirement is enforced.

**Please note that we are a spiritual group - not a singles group or dating service.  It is suggested that you move on to another group that is more suited for meeting singles if that is your purpose.**

About your High Priestess:

Niki Somers is a third-degree Mohsian Wiccan High Priestess and Ordained Spiritualist, able to perform life event services (handfastings, legal marriages, wiccanings, etc.) as well as many other spiritual services, such as emotional cord-cutting, energy healing, house cleansings/blessings, spiritual counseling, etc.  As a former state-certified high school English teacher, Niki incorporates her training in both the mundane and magickal worlds, enabling her to guide you in the mastery of your personal, mental, and energetic development.  She holds a Bachelor's Degree in English and an Associates' Degree in Psychology.  In addition to teaching, her experience includes the counseling and socialization of the schizophrenic, having assisted Dr. Donald Springer of the Friendship House in Hackensack in his group counseling and social activities program.  She is the founder/leader of Bergen Wiccan & Pagan Group (created in 2007), which is the open circle of the Coven that operates it.  As the High Priestess, she runs the Coven and is responsible for the Coven training of all new members as well as overseeing Bergen Wiccan.  BW&PG provides spiritual guidance to those who seek the Light by providing many services such as spiritual counseling, energy/Reiki healing, meditation, Tarot readings, and runs open classes on various subjects such as Wicca, Astrology, Tarot card reading, and Past Life regression, just to name a few.
results.name: Bergen Wiccan and Pagan Group

results.description:
LEZ Factor (lezfactor.com) has created the “NYC Women Who Like Women” Meet-up group - a dynamic, fun-filled, discussion-driven collection of women coming together to chat about the intricacies of lesbian dating.  We facilitate informal activities/discussions on what that initial attraction to another woman is like, challenges we face as women dating women, and even best practices for meeting other quality women in New York City.

Our events cater to a collective of bi-curious women who are looking to openly connect with other women who share similar fantasies, for bisexual women looking to find ways to interact with other bisexual women, and for lesbians, who by default, just love women and equally enjoy talking about them.

Women like women.  That’s a fact.  Some women are just curious about dating other women, but never have.  Others love everything about them and aren’t afraid to admit it.  Whether you’re a woman who has only fantasized about dating another woman, or identify as a lesbian, our events are perfect for you.  Our functions take place at exclusive lounges or private venues around New York City.  We make sure to create a laid-back environment, so that you can meet other women in a setting outside of the typical, pressure-filled lesbian bar or club.

Through this group, LEZ Factor is promoting the power of socializing with confidence.  What better place to put your social abilities to good use than in a setting that was specifically designed for it?

Simply put, it’s a fun, structured way to connect with women who are equally excited about connecting with you.  All we ask is that you bring an open mind, an open heart, and a desire to mix and mingle with a new group of beautiful women.  We’ll take care of the rest.

Men talk about women all the time. Why can't we?  :)
results.name: LEZ Factor's NYC Women Who Like Women

results.description:
Natural Movement NYC is a group for those who wish to strengthen their body and mind through principles and techniques of using our muscles and movements in a way the human body has evolved outdoors in nature over the last million years.

Originally inspired by MovNat (www.movnat.com), we hone the body's 12 movements and improvise fun and challenging ways of utilizing our body's extensive natural abilities. We climb trees and rocks, lift logs, balance ourselves on narrow surfaces, learn carrying techniques of objects and each other, do ground work involving learning how to fall, crawl, and roll, do a variety of animal walks, precision jumping, work together as a team to accomplish a task, and anything else that's fun and gets the heart going!

Our membership draws from the barefoot running, crossfit, parkour and paleo crowd as well as those who just want to have fun outside and do something different with their workout. Being outside and moving naturally as our bodies were meant to will give you not only a great workout, but a true sense of fulfillment of your natural instincts and a greater body awareness.

We're out there to have fun and to get back to what our bodies were designed for.

Join us!

 

*Please note that you join us and perform at your own risk. The organizers of this group are in no way responsible for any injuries that may occur.

results.description:
To introduce myself: 

My name is Nicole and I live in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn.

After spending most of my 20s and early 30s alone, I have found myself in a happy relationship (knock on wood).  I have attended singles meet-ups, key parties, speed dating . . . and, of course, done a great deal of online dating.  And now. . . perhaps it's cliché . . . but I would like to help others by creating a group that I wish existed when I was single.

Why I created the group?

I found speed dating to be great fun and very efficient, although ultimately not successful for me.

Why? 

I never found a group just for Brooklynites.

I ended up finding a great guy on OK Cupid . . . who lives in Bayside, Queens and is very attached to his neighborhood.

Two words: geographically undesirable! ( but I’m keeping him anyway)

Also, I always wanted more specific speed dating demographics.  For instance, I'm a abundantly feminine woman (my favorite term used by a former date . . . aka zaftig, voluptuous, full figured, bbw). I never found a speed dating event for women like me, and the men who would be interested.

Therefore, I would like to start this group to offer speed dating in Brooklyn. Down the road, if I am able to get enough participants, I will be able to hold speed dating for specific interests, and perhaps other types of singles events and matchmaking.

 Why should you join?

Because . . .

  • You are single, busy, and willing to take a chance.
  • It will be fun . . .  it's my goal to make sure you at the very least have a drink, meet people, and laugh.
  • To join is free.  There will be a cost for events, TBD based on number of attendees and location.

 So, please join, please answer the questionnaire.  If you don't want to answer publically e-mail me.

This will help me create better events.
results.name: Brooklyn Speed Dating

results.description:
Note: We have many people attending this ongoing class besides the few listed as attending on the meetup website.

About the Instructor

Rick Stack, was a student of Seth & Jane Roberts and personally attended over 100 Seth sessions given in Jane Roberts' classes in Elmira, NY. He is the President of New Awareness Network Inc., "The Seth Bookstore" (www.sethcenter.com) and one of the main publishers of the Seth books by Jane Roberts (inc. The Seth Audio Collection, The Early Sessions (Books 1-9 of the Seth Material), The Personal Sessions, and other books by Jane Roberts. Author of "Out Of Body Adventures" (Contemporary Books 1988), he has been teaching workshops on the Seth material, Dreams, Out of Body Experiences and metaphysics throughout the United States and abroad for over 35 years. He has been on the faculty of many schools throughout the United States and has appeared on numerous radio and television shows. Over a 20 year period Rick worked with Jane's husband Rob Butts on the publication of previously unpublished Seth material. His current projects include being on the board of advisors for The World Peace Festival Berlin, and a global outreach program to educate and introduce people to the Seth material (www.sethlearningcenter.org).

Class Description
You can "come awake" from your normal waking state and that is the natural next step for consciousness to follow...
-Seth

This class will provide an ongoing framework for the practical application of Seth's teachings on the importance and methods of achieving "higher" states of consciousness, "spiritual" exploration, and communication with our own greater being. It will also address the connection between these higher states of consciousness and the art of creating your own reality, including the elimination of any limiting beliefs that interfere with our energy, growth or fulfillment.

Throughout the body of the Seth Material, Seth discusses a major step in our growth which involves moving out of the "official line of consciousness," the conventional framework of viewing reality. Again and again, Seth encourages us to take the steps that will lead to a new birth of consciousness, a new far more effective and far more expansive mode of operation, that he has alternately described as the "higher intellect," the "spacious mind," an "expansion of identity," an "awakening", the "magical approach," and "spiritualized creaturehood."

"When that point of awareness strikes you fully...a new kind of consciousness is born in you...You feel the birth of intellect and intuition together, in a high intellect, in which you recognize your own superior functioning." -Seth

In this intimate class setting we will explore key areas of the Seth material and support each other in achieving the "awakening" mentioned above. Select Audiotape excerpts of Seth speaking on these topics during Jane Robert's classes, including some never before published, will be integrated into the workshop. Topics covered will include:

  • How to trigger the "higher intellect" and "accelerated states of consciousness"
  • Using direct links to the wisdom of the inner self
  • Letting Go - Joining with the spontaneous self.
  • The inner senses and our capacity for "Direct Comprehension"
  • Conscious creation - The art of using your unlimited energy and power to create your ideal life...
  • Reconnecting with your non-physical "entity."
  • Expanding your concept of identity and becoming a "new, larger" you.
  • The "magical" approach and the pitfalls of the conventional "rational" approach.
  • Moving out of the "official line of consciousness" - How to break free from stubborn cultural limiting belief systems.
results.name: New York City Seth Study Group (Instructor-Rick Stack)

results.description:
CALLING ALL
MOTOCYCLETTERASTS

NY area wahlbergs, spankys, pacinos, urkels, pitts, jolies, cobains, rossis, nikitas, connerys, thurmans, diesels, snipes, lucy lius, vangoghs, austin powerses, clouds, griers, bruce lees, spidermen and other accomplished, slick, boffo two-wheeled bohemians, burners and other creatives in search of a home . . .

 



A new concept in motorcycling
based outta NYC


"An unconventional, paradigm-shifting
motorbike think-tank,
entertainment and riding group"

 


What is Biker Entourage?

Social motorcycling for urban creatives? Gotham gonzos 'n geeks on bikes? . . . Whatever you wanna call us, we think it's time to move beyond the handful of biker molds (riding clubs, stunters, 1%s, track junkies) and bring the Motorcycle into the progress that's unfolding around us.


Let's start by recognizing what gives bikes their potentially groundbreaking nature. Riding can be a foray into godliness, more profound to an individual's experience than the discovery of the god particle. Motorcycles bring relativity theory into the personal, giving mortals the ability to start pushing the c of E=mc2. If the m stands for motorcycle and the E stands for Experience ... then we've got all bases covered.

Add the human factor--the open minds and fierce hearts shared by brothers and sisters who ride--to a fun, outside the box, black rock ethos, and we've got a concoction that's sure to push some envelopes and raise some eyebrows.

You don't have to ride to come aboard. We're seeking partnerships with event producers, performers, PR pros, web designers & creatives of all ilks.

 


H A R N E S S I N G   T H E   S O C I A L   &   C R E A T I V E   P O W E R   O F   T H E   M O T O R C Y C L E

Biker Entourage was initially started for rides, shits 'n giggles but has morphed into something far more alarming.

AN ILLUMINATI FOR GONZO BIKERS

Harnessing the creative potential, intelligence & success of our area's bikers, who've an engine roaring through their heart and the wind on their face (hopefully not from the rider in front).

MUTUAL SUPPORT
Based on the loyalty the motorcycle brings with it, including networking for projects, babysitters and bank jobs.

BIKES CHANGE EVERYTHING
Ever done interactive theater, Burning Man or Bike Kill? Add inspiration from stuff like psychogeography & Ingress and you've got rides and experiences that recognize how bikes can change eveything. 

BIKER QUEST

We got a hella augmented reality adventure under development and comin your way...[cue music]...Biker Quest. You'll def wannna be a part of the beta launch. Why? How bout because it'll be nothing short of an epiphany of intense and ridiculous fun. Make sure you get an invite by signing up on our email list.

NO RULES . . . except these two:
RULE 1: If you're a biker--and you've survived everything that's trying to terminate you (or serve you up with an assfull of roadrash)--you deserve props no matter what you ride.

RULE 2: We've all got different philosophies in life, but the golden rule is RESPECT (mutual that is). No fighting, endagering other bikers, or any other squidlike/douchey behavior. If youre prone to this then BEnt aint for you.




R I D E S   &   E V E N T S   P L A N N E D   F O R   2 0 1 3

These are the 6 events planned for this season (and that we're gonna need help with):

Motorcycle Theater
A paradigm shift in participatory theater, where our bikes lead us to the novel and the unexpected. Theater that is experienced not from a stationary perspective but in all four dimensions, and that requires our active participation as coconspirators. Using the motorcycle's spacial and temporal superpowers can add exponentially to creative possibilities in performance art and theatrical experience. Encounters will include burlesque and other performances in unlikely places, an ad hoc street dance club, and other surprises.

Scavenger Hunt and Interdimensional Motoportation Ride
Romping around the city, where the challenges will include psychedelic clues, shots, the abduction of humans and other fun times. Oh yeah and interdimensional teleportation.

Three Dolla Charity Ride
