results.description:
Qi gong or Qigong[1] or Chi kung[2] (气功 or prana force) is the philosophy and practice of aligning breath, physical activity and awareness for mental, spiritual and corporeal health, as well as the development of human potential.[3] It includes certain forms of martial arts[4] and the spiritual awakening to one's true nature.[5]
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qigong

Anyone Can: It doesn't matter if your are young, old, healthy or ill, Qigong is for everyone.

Qigong is ideal for reducing stress, alleviating chronic pain, and improving overall aging issues.  It is also great for maintaining calmness, staying centered, becoming grounded, and experiencing relaxation anywhere, including the workplace and at home.

Easily: Our Qigong exercises, using a combination of breath coordination, body movements, and mental intentions are simple, easy to learn and effective.

Qigong is a wonderful supplement to other body-mind practices as well as a powerful independent practice.  Qigong exercises includes various of breath-movements that can range from strong and pronounced to calm and unnoticable.  Most exercises can be performed while lying, sitting or standing.  The movements of Qigong and each set of exercises are designed to strengthen and relax certain acupuncture meridians and organ systems.

Experience: Experience new levels of health, energy & relaxation through Qigong.  Qigong brings the yin and yang forces of the body together back into harmony by bringing scattered energy back together.

The result is that you are more relaxed and feel more energized.  By feeling better or great it increases your productivity and focus.

Benefits: The workout that will extend your warranty.

America's Doctor, Dr. Oz, says the ancient Chinese technique of Qigong is a great way tap into our natural energy and, in turn, combat the aging process.

http://www.oprah.com/health/Dr-Oz-in-Using-Qigong-to-Combat-Aging-Video

Qigong exercises are performed to increase and balance the flow of qi or energy throughout the body.  The exercises also promotes the development of balance, coordination, flexibility, strength, and endurance. Coordinated deep breathing with the movements promote relaxation and develops the mind-body connection.  Practice of Qigong leads to the enhancement of physical, mental, and spiritual health.  Qigong also promotes "Natural Energetic Healing" which greatly helps to provide relief from chronic aches and pains, negative emotions, and deficient immune systems.

 

Contact Us: Come explore Qigong-NYC.com Take an individual class or a whole series. No matter what you decide – it will be a step toward aligning and empowering your mind, body and spirit.
www.qigong-nyc.com

If any of you would like to be added to the Qigong NYC newsletter email list, you can send an email to me at:
info@qigong-nyc.com

Check out our about us page to get more information about us.
Or go to http://qigong-nyc.com/
or go to http://gemhypnosis.com/qigong
keywords: qi gong qigong chi kung

Do you want to get outdoors and have a great time doing amazing things?  Then join us on our next adventure!  We love introducing people to all that the great outdoors has to offer!  Rock climbing, hiking, backpacking, kayaking, canoeing, rafting, ice climbing, snow shoeing, mountain biking, mountaineering, skiing, herpetology, dendrology, wilderness survival and SO MUCH MORE!  We also run some kid friendly adventures!  So come out, bring the kids, bring your friends and join us on a great adventure! As a member of this meetup group you'll receive discounts on trips and courses from our sponsors.

 

This Meetup group is sponsored by the following outdoor companies/organizations:

Professional Hiking Guides Association (PHGA): http://www.hikingtraining.com/

Northeast Mountain Guiding: http://www.northeastmountainguiding.com

Edge of the Woods Outfitters

Thrifty Adventures

Professional Climbing Guides Institute (PCGI): http://www.guidesinstitute.org

Bayshore Search & Rescue: https://www.facebook.com/NJBSAR

 

 

Brief information from one of our sponsors, Northeast Mountain Guiding:

We've been operating as a guiding outfit for over 4 years now and are one of the largest and busiest guiding outfits in the Eastern US.  We operate in the Northeastern US, Southwestern US, Southeastern US, Mid-Atlantic US, Colorado, Alaska and close to 20 other countries around the world through affiliate guiding outfits.  We currently have 7 offices worldwide and are working on our 8th office in North Carolina.

All of our US guides hold a CPR for the Professional Rescuer certification. We have Wilderness EMTs, Remote Paramedics, Registered Nurses and Wilderness First Responders on staff at all times.  Our Wilderness First Responders and EMTs are certified with the state they guide in because most states are not "Nationally registered" states so being certified in that state is a must when treating patients in order to be covered under state laws and regulations.  Our US based guides hold certifications through various organizations.  Our rock climbing guides are trained and/or certified through the Professional Climbing Guides Institute (PCGI) and/or the American Mountain Guides Association (AMGA).  We have PCGI Top-Rope to Multi-Pitch Guides and AMGA Single Pitch Instructors to full Rock Guides on staff.  We are also course providers for the Professional Hiking Guides Association and the Professional Climbing Guides Institute.  Our Backpacking and Mountaineering Guides are certified through the Professional Hiking Guides Association.  Our water sport based guides hold certifications for the course they are instructing through the American Canoe Association.

 

Feel free to contact our New Jersey office by email or phone: info@northeastmountainguiding.com or (848) 468-6735

Please check out our website: www.northeastmountainguiding.com

Add us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/NEGuiding

results.description:
When I got into beekeeping in March of 2010, I noticed that there was no organized group of beekeepers on Staten Island.   Every other borough had one, but not Staten Island.  That's when I decided to start this one.  I was curious to know how much response it would get.  I'm happy to see that the membership has been growing steadily and there is a core group of active members.

Mission

The mission of this group is to promote beekeeping and educate the public about the importance of honeybees.  Please join and participate if you have any interest in supporting these efforts.

Honeybee Facts Honeybees are not aggressive by nature, and will not sting unless protecting their hive from an intruder or are unduly provoked.  The purpose of the honeybee hive is to support the existence of the colony.  The queens purpose is to lay eggs and she may live for 3-4 years, the worker honeybees feed and nurture the eggs so that they hatch in 21 days and they may live up to 6-7weeks.  The worker bees pollinate our plants while collecting nectar and pollen to make honey to feed the developing bees.  Drone bees may live up to 3-4 months and their primary role is to mate with the queen so she can lay eggs.

Honeybee Swarms

If you spot any swarms, please notify us immediately since they don't stay very long.  Also inform your friends and neighbors that they are not aggressive and they should not spray to kill them!! They are especially docile when swarming and preparing to relocate to their new home.  They will not attack or bother anyone.  There is always someone in the group interested in the captured swarm and their survival.

Importance of Honeybees

Colony collapse disorder (CCD) is drastically reducing the number of honeybees which affects our food supply due to the lack of pollination the bees offer to our crops.

Quoted from the mother nature network: "Just how important are honeybees to the human diet? Typically, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture, these under-appreciated workers pollinate 80 percent of our flowering crops which constitute 1/3 of everything we eat. Losing them could affect not only dietary staples such as apples, broccoli, strawberries, nuts, asparagus, blueberries and cucumbers, but may threaten our beef and dairy industries if alfalfa is not available for feed. One Cornell University study estimated that honeybees annually pollinate $14 billion worth of seeds and crops in the U.S. Essentially, if honeybees disappear, they could take most of our insect pollinated plants with them, potentially reducing mankind to little more than a water diet." (http://www.mnn.com/local-reports/pennsylvania/local-blog/the-importance-of-honeybees)

Health Benefits of Local and Raw Honey

Read about how local honey helps allergies at: http://health.howstuffworks.com/diseases-conditions/allergies/allergy-treatments/local-honey-for-allergies.htm

Visit this site for other health benefits of raw honey:  http://www.livestrong.com/article/246023-what-are-the-benefits-of-pure-honey/

Thanks for your support!

Debra Butera
results.name: Staten Island Beekeepers

results.description:
Come Relax and Meditate with Us! We are an open, friendly, non-sectarian, non-stuffy group of people who meditate together -- and support one another.

When it comes to moving along on the spiritual path, it's not easy to go it alone. We all need support. And our warm group energy gives lots of that support.

Our teachers, Merrill and Tamaji, are also there to encourage and assist us. They also offer instruction to beginners, so they can comfortably explore the field for themselves, see if meditation enhances their lives as much as it does ours.

As for instruction, our meditation teachings are simple and practical. We start beginners by showing them how easy it is to relax profoundly, rather than merely relaxing temporarily or superficially. For those who want more, then, we provide personalized meditation tools that deepen and expand inner peace and, ultimately, lead in the direction of complete Self-realization. What could be bad about that?

Anyone is invited to visit one of our support group meetings. There is never any charge.

Members can come to any or all of those meetings -- no advance notice is necessary. Did I mention we were accepting? Click on "Photos" in the left sidebar to see some scenes of us.

Our group includes people of all faiths -- and no faith. We are flexible, informal and, not infrequently, just plain silly. We've been meeting for some time before Meetup began, so we already have about 50 active members in Westchester, a dozen or so of whom show up at any individual meeting.

Exploratory visits and inquiries more than welcome! Merrill's wife, Tamaji is the contact person for questions and for confirming the time and place of meetings. She's usually home. Call her anytime, perhaps just to get acquainted. Her number: 914-946-5334.
.

We meet at the Rubin every Friday, except for summers.  During the summer months, we meet at the Rubin every 2nd and 4th week, but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as they come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists and travelers randomly in Kathamandu, India, Japan, Korea... And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City.  Greg, the founder, was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  Everyone became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like-minded hang-out spot in New York. If you like Buddhas or to meditate - then you'll love the Rubin!

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff will know where we are.

www.dharmadrink.com

Please see Buddhist Events New York on Meetup.com too!

results.description:
Welcome to the Washington/Hudson Heights Book Club, we're glad you're here. A bit about us…

About Us

We're uptown readers in the Washington and Hudson Heights neighborhoods who love to read. We're looking for other book folk to read with us, share food, drink and have conversation. We're laid back, pretty hilarious, and love books. Nothing stuffy about us.

About Book Club

We're a group who mixes it up by exploring a range of authors/genres -- fiction, memoir, debuts, classics, cultural, horror, current events, etc. Books that introduce new authors, revisit favorites, add different perspectives, get you out of your reading routine and possible comfort zone.

Who Picks Books
You do! Each month we take turns; selecting a book from a different genre is encouraged. When it's your go round, think about the difference between "a good read" and "a good book for discussion." One that will spark conversation, a book that'll raise questions/issues we can't stop talking or laughing about. You know that book! It's how we keep it fresh.

Location
We get together in members' living rooms over wine/beer/bevs plus lots of chips, salsa, and hummus. Kicking off your shoes is highly encouraged.

When
We meet once a month on a Friday. A relaxing welcome to the weekend.

Pets

Some of us will have dogs, others cats. We'll let you know ahead of time if that's the case.  Our dogs are small and super cute.

RSVP

Kindly drop your spot if you RSVP'd and cannot attend so those on the wait list can participate.

Happy reading. Shoot us an email anytime if you have questions or suggestions.

Enjoy!


Kathy and Ruthie
results.name: Washington/Hudson Heights Book Club

World Savers aims to not just talk about saving the world, but to actually formulate and launch solutions to the world's biggest and most urgent problems - hunger, poverty, education, equal rights and environmental concerns are just a few affecting this beautiful and fragile world.

- Is what you are doing now really fullfilling to you?
- Is it making a difference in something or someone elses life, other than allowing you to afford for your simple desires?
- Do you see problems around you which bother you?
- Do you have or are you the solution or part of it?

 

So what are you waiting for? We can only accomplish such a monumental undertaking if we do so together, pooling talents and resources for our common cause - mother earth.

If you are hearing the calling and wish to finally make a difference together, please join us.

results.description:
Do you love climbing and other outdoor adventures?  Do you love challenging yourself, and leaning over the edge of your comfort zone?  Do you find it hard to separate your love of nature from the environment you wish to preserve or the creatures you wish to let live?  Do you wish you could share this with others who "get it"?

Welcome to Vedge.  I am truly grateful for the friends I have made through this meetup and the adventures we have shared.  We seem to attract some of the nicest, most thoughtful, and conscientious climbers I've met.

We climb for all different reasons.  Gym climbing for some is a fun and social alternative to a conventional gym.  Others want to go out and test their mettle on the most challenging outdoor climbs nature has to offer.  We are fortunate to have the Gunks, some of the best climbing east of the Mississippi only a two hour drive away.  Regardless, we will enjoy lots of great veggie food along the way, roast tofu-pups over the camp fire, etc.

So join us for a dinner and/or gym climbing event.  We warmly welcome all abilities, from those who have never climbed, to those pushing their limits on 5.12 and higher.  Vegans, vegetarians, and vegetarian wannabes are all welcome.

Disclaimer of Liability:

CLIMBING IS A DANGEROUS SPORT!

Involvement in rock climbing carries a significant risk of personal injury or death. CLIMB AT YOUR OWN RISK!
results.name: Vedge: Northeast Vegetarian Rock Climbers and Adventurers

results.description:
Hi there!

Do you enjoy discovering new/offbeat or classic independent/foreign films and discussing them with other film lovers?   Do you also love trying new types of food and wine?

If so, come join us!

We are a group of young film, food & wine buffs (mostly early 30's to early 40's) who live in the city, and get together several times a month in a private, relaxed setting  with comfy seating and large screen TV, for film, food & wine parties. 

We romp around the globe, pairing up foreign (sometimes just indie) films with foreign wines, and sometimes  vodka, rum and whiskey, (hey...apparently they can't grow grapes in Denmark), along with appetizers, side dishes and desserts. 

Since we meet in private homes and want to create an environment where everyone really gets a chance to talk to each other, our events are typically limited to 10 - 12 guests, who each come on their own.

Our set-up is a wonderful way to meet new people who share the same interests and spark thought-provoking and passionate conversations. And sometimes we just laugh our butts off.

Each event has its own special twist for the wine & food, and everyone attending brings something that complements the film.

Our goal is to create a fun-themed dinner party around a movie....and the end result is often pretty amazing, as we have some super-talented chefs among us, who often whip up masterpieces that are truly a treat.  But no worries at all if you don't cook! Picking up something on the way is just fine.

We're also always happy to find new hosts for future events.  All that's required is a space in NYC (Manhattan-Brooklyn-Queens) that can comfortably seat at least 8 guests, a large (37"+) screen and be open to welcoming an eclectic & interesting group of film-food-wine lovers into your home.

If this sounds like a group you might enjoy, sign on up!  We can't wait to meet you!
results.name: NYC Indie-Foreign Film, Food & Wine

Sing and Sign with Baby and Mommy on the Upper West Side, NYC is for moms and babies or toddlers who would like to come to meet new friends in a fun and creative way!  You will have access to discounted music and Baby Sign Language classes all over the Upper West Side (UWS) in New York City. Class locations spread across the entire Upper West Side (UWS) from the 50's to 100th Street and are welcome to all moms and babies at any signing level!

This "musical playdate" will have baby-friendly instruments, props, movement activities, & full-band background track music for both moms and infants, babies, and toddlers and will provide ways for you to meet new friends with similar interests.  The music is a unique blend of fun kids music that everyone loves and enjoys mixed with many educational original Baby Grand Orchestra children's songs.

Baby Sign Language will be taught through the music to help infants, babies, toddlers, and moms to remember and use the signs at home.   The instructor has her BA in Musical Theater Education and a Masters in Deaf Education/American Sign Language and has 10 years teaching experience with students of all ages.

These mommy / baby classes have among the lowest prices in NYC.

New Winter Promotion Starting Jan 1, 2014: To encourage continuity of moms/babies, there is a $40 discount on semester cards!

Trial: $20

Drop-In :    $25  Come anytime, pay when you come, no future commitment!

Bring A Friend : $10 discount that day for every new face you bring to Baby Grand Orchestra

Semester Card: $160  ($40 discount)
-8 classes--expires 2 months from the purchase date
-Can be used several times in one week!

Siblings & Host :  Half off

Please see BabyGrandOrchestra.com

Please join Sing & Sign with Baby on the Upper West Side of New York City (NYC) if you would like to sing, learn Baby Sign, dance, play, learn, drum, tap, jump, wiggle, listen to great music (educational children's favorites & Baby Grand Orchestra originals), and meet new mommy & baby friends! Can't wait to Sing & Sign with YOU!

North Jersey Free Events Group for Families welcomes babies, moms/dads and pregnant mums-to-be!

We are a social group of parents with babies (0-24 months) and some with babies on the way! The purpose of the group is for us to get together, share our wonderful baby experiences and allow our babies to have friends of the same age to play with as they grow! We also make new  friends along the way! We run playdates in parks, play gyms, pools. zoos, libraries, and more! We are always looking for new places to explore.

We host a variety of fun activities for babies as our passionate and creative parents are encouraged to host their own playdates.

results.description:
This meet up group is a social group designed for new moms in the Fairfield /Westchester County area.  The age of the children range from 1 year to max 4 years old because play dates and outings are mostly structured around those age groups.

We offer play dates and support with a caring group of moms.  We also meet up monthly with moms only for our "Moms Night Out" since we all need that sometimes!

I started this group when my son was born in Spring 2011.  Since then, so many fabulous moms from our area have joined and we have been able to foster some terrific friendships.

Formally known as "New Moms of Greenwich,"  Toddler Moms of Greenwich moms group affords you the opportunity to expose yourself and children to some great people and some great events around the Greenwich area.  It allows you to create those bonds to share everything Greenwich has to offer and more...

** If you have a suggestion, or are planning an event that you would like to open up to the moms group, please feel free to email me and I will send out an email blast to the group.  Emails can be controlled through the account settings on this site.

Expand you social circles.

Meet fabulous local moms.

Join Toddler Moms of Greenwich.

We are now on Facebook under CHIC Moms of Greenwich. Send us a request there so you can share photos, and it's also an easier way to take part in discussions,  suggestions, recommendations re all things, businesses, classes, schools, drs, etc about toddlers/ moms around Greenwich.
results.name: Toddler Moms of Greenwich, CT

results.description: "Latina's on the Move" is a meetup exclusively for women, where unique and passionate Latinas can come together, share their interests, network, celebrate, have fun, and enjoy all the aspects of what makes us phenomenal women! I decided to try and revive this group after learning the group was about to shut down and feeling like I didn't want to let it go without giving it another shot at life.  Where were my ladies at?!  I'd love us to take advantage of what our amazing City has to offer. I'm passionate about friendships and living la vida and looking forward to connecting with like minded, smart, professional, down-to-earth, and culturally passionate Latinas who are super cool just like me (smile), so..."why don't I know more of these women?!" WHO SHOULD JOIN/STICK AROUND? Mature, beautiful 25 to 40 something's, Latina Women who live, work, or play in the New York (and hopefully some in Long Island) and are hoping to get to know and network with other like minded Latinas. PURPOSE OF THE GROUP:  To create a dynamic online space for sharing and building a dope network of friendships. Just in time for late Summer and Fall, let's attempt to meetup live and in person as often as comfortable and visit cool events, restaurants, lounges or a nice inexpensive happy hour.  We decide! Let's get together and hopefully create some long-lasting friendships :-) Thanks for coming by and checking out this meetup group. Hope to meet you soon! -Dawn.

results.description:
General Description

We are an exclusive group comprised of young professionals, advanced volleyball players who want to be physically active by playing competitive, yet fun and exciting volleyball games. Some of us have been playing with each other for over three-four years and have established an amazing dynamic. We are looking for advanced or high intermediate volleyball players who have positive attitudes, are good sports, collaborate well with others and people who are laid back in the sense that their main priority is to enjoy the game and not to complain about trivial issues. If you are a carefree and upbeat advanced player who wants to meet new and interesting people, and have some laughs in the process, you will have a great time here.  Besides volleyball games, we also have a couple of socials throughout the season so we can get to know each other off the field and to continue the good times and friendly banter in another setting. This group is a great way to meet people!

We play on weekends, roughly 3-4x per month from April to October. 

Level of Play - Very Important

The level of play is only high intermediate/advanced so please only join if you have been playing the sport for a while, know the rules of the game and are adept in all areas (bumping, setting and spiking).  We only do three hits before passing the ball to the other side.  Maintaining an intermediate level makes it fun for everybody involved.  Feel free to invite friends, but please make sure they are intermediate players.  Thank you.

Here is a general established definition from a volleyball organization:

“Any player who consistently displays advanced ability in either offensive skills (spiking, serving, setting) or defensive skills (passing, digging, blocking) to compete as a specialist and has sufficient ability to execute the dynamics of power volleyball. This player has begun to master the use of power and shots and is beginning to handle pace, has sound footwork, can control depth of shots, and is beginning to vary game plan according to opponents.”

Cost

The cost for a 2.5 -3 hr. session is $5.00, which covers meetup fees, equipment, organizational duties and a host of other things and can be paid in person, please bring exact change..  There are usually two sessions - morning and afternoon, each session is $5.
results.name: NYC Coed High Intermediate/Advanced Sand Volleyball

results.description:
NYC Meditate in Prospect Park & Central Park for Free

Please always check on the Meetup event to see if it has been cancelled if it has been raining or bad weather looks likely. Thank you.

Well, that about says it all!

I've been thinking for some time about getting a group of people together to practice meditation in the park.

It would be really wonderful to get everyone together. And there is a special beauty about a group of people practicing meditation in the park - especially in New York, the speedy city!

Maybe grab a coffee or tea afterwards and hang out a little bit.

So, let's meet and just take it from there.

Parents with kids are welcome!

And, of course, it's totally free.

A student of Tibetan Buddhism for a long time, I got back from spending a few years in the Himalayas in 2009. Happy to offer a few pointers to help you get started if you’d like.

Please go to  WWW.DHARMASUN.ORG  and  WWW.WHATMEDITATIONREALLYIS.COM  for excellent free video instructions on practicing meditation - it's just amazing what is online these days!!! I had to go to Tibetan Buddhist Monasteries in the Himalayas - you can watch it at home on your laptop!! It's just incredible....

Bring a yoga mat/ blanket + a comfy cushion to sit on cross-legged (or a chair if better for you), and water.

Please wear layers as it may warm up or cool down. Take care.

Check Meetup group "Buddhist Events New York" to hear about teachers and classes in the NY metro.

And don't miss "Dharma Drink" at the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday nights - here on Meetup too.
results.name: NYC Meditate in Prospect Park & Central Park for Free

Welcome All Spiritual Seekers Of Truth & Light! Our Healing Workshops, Full & New Moon Circles, Shamanic Drumming Circles, & Spiritual Travel Retreats have finally found its home in historical Brooklyn, NY.

We offer a Smorgosbord of different healing modalities, tools and techniques to assist you and your family and friends to simply feel better. We hold the space and will be the witness for you to heal yourself in a safe and supportive environment. We are here to facilitate your own healing process by introducing you to a whole new world of spiritual practices that you might not have known about before. With this new information, you can make better choices and live more consciously coming from a more peaceful and loving place.

I am a Reiki Master, Intuitive Energy & Sound Healer, Consciousness Facilitator, & Meditation Instructor who has a passion for helping people help themselves. I teach psychic development classes and Energetic Healing Techniques so you can remember who you are, what your Dharma (mission) is, and why you chose to come to our 3rd dimensional planet earth at this important time. Assisting others to empower and trust their special gifts is one of many things I have come here to do. This truly inspires and motivates me to bring my healing services to the city I was born in and have always lived in.

You can join our group if you are ready to open up, raise and expand your consciousness, meditate, participate in Family Constellation Therapy, meet new friends, connect with your Soul Family, and share your beautiful spirit with others. We will offer lectures and seminars from various teachers and authors, offer devotional chanting and Kirtans, live sound healing music and meditation circles, Astrology, Channeling your spirit guides, Kaballah, Women's Goddess support groups, healthy mind/healthy body workshops, Ayurveda, Shamanism from the Brazilian Rainforest, Psychic Fairs, Grandmother Wisdom Circles, Film Screenings, Reiki Classes & Circles, The Bars Energy Process For Clearing, Law Of Attraction Intenders Circles, Breath Work Groups, Osho Meditations, Trance Dance movement classes, Ceremonies, Native American sweat lodges, trips to pow-wows, and spiritual travel retreats to Peru and Siberia.

We Brooklynites are Ready to make positive changes in our lives, to open our minds and our hearts, and to re-connect with each other. We will meet at various healing centers and at our members homes or studios. Please email us if you would like to donate your space for healing services and events. We also want to reach out to families, especially those who are struggling with a diagnosis of Autism, PPD, ADD, OCD or Aspergers. Our goal is to encourage loving and non-violent communication among family members by changing our focus and re-framing our perceptions based on unconditional love. Many teenagers are misunderstood and may act out leading to stress and tension in the family unit. Brooklynites Unite in love, service, and devotion to the planet and to each other. Please RSVP for events that you find interesting and would like to learn more about and experience yourself. Our workshops are dedicated to presenting the artistic side of glamour and figure photography. We concentrate on lighting techniques, posing the model, creative sets and locations, and using a concept for the shoot. We welcome accomplished professionals, serious amateurs, and beginners that are new to picture taking. If you are interested in photography, and photographing models dressed up and undressed, this group is for you.

The Photo Workshops are usually held on the third or fourth Sunday of the Month. Most shoots are held at our studios in Montclair, NJ. Some workshops will be held on location in natural settings. Setting up photo shoots with great models requires much planning, lots of work and expense. The fee for our monthly Sunday Workshops is $100.00. They run from 1:00 to 5:00 PM, unless other wise posted.

Members of the Montclair Glamour and Figure Photography Workshop pay a $12.50 membership fee for the first year, for consecutive years the membership fee is $25.00, this helps off set the cost and time involved in organizing the group. Co-operation from all of the participants is important. To join our group click on join us button a the top of this page, fill out the the questions on the "Request to Join Page" and hit submit. Then go to:  http://www.glamourmodelsinternational.com/join.html   this our companion website, once you have submitted your credit card information, you will be given access to  Glamour Models International, and with in a day you will approved be by the organizer for access to this MeetUP website.

Our models range from tall, slender fashion model types to short, sexy well endowed women. All our models are photogenic. We need models for our Sunday Workshops, and other events and product and fashion shoots we have at the studio. These are always PAID assignments. If you are interested in modeling for the workshops, email at the address below.

You may find additional information about our workshops by going to our companion website: http://www.glamourmodelsinternational.com/

Please e-mail me if you are interested or if you have any questions, my direct email is montclair.photo.workshop@gmail.com

ALL WORKSHOP ATTENDEES & GROUP MEMBERS AND MODELS MUST BE AT LEAST 18 YEARS OLD.

Steve Carver

results.description:
Introduction

This group is for anyone who likes producing electronic music using software, and/or wishes to learn new production skills, other software products, find out about various plug-ins, and take their mixes to the next level.

There is no particular skill requirement to join the group. However if you are a beginner, we recommend you at least try a demo version of a popular DAW software package, and watch some free tutorials on youtube before coming to your first meeting.

We mostly concentrate on Ableton Live and various plug-ins but we’re open to other DAW (Digital Audio Workstation) software, e.g. Logic, Cubase, Sonar, Reason, etc. PC or Mac – it doesn’t matter.

Hardware music makers are also welcome, so if you like making electronic music without a computer, well, we do too!

Once you join, check out the “Pages” section with useful information, e.g. links to plug-ins we use, tutorial videos, etc.

Structure of Our Events

We usually have a couple of presenters each time showing various techniques that most producers could benefit from. The presentations last 10-20 minutes each, plus Q&A. After that, it’s a free-form forum for everyone to chat, exchange ideas, contact info, etc.


Membership

Membership is free. However, there may be a small (e.g. $10) fee per event to cover the room/equipment rental. We will let you know on the invite if the venue requires a donation.


Presenting

If you are interested in presenting a topic at a particular event, please contact the organizer with the details. Presenters benefit from
• Free instant and invaluable feedback from the other members
• Recognition – you’ll be famous in our circle :)

Topics

Here is the list of topics regularly covered at our events
• Intro to Ableton Live
• Basic computer / studio set-up
• Synthesizers and sound design
• Mixing techniques
• Unique plug-ins
• Reverbs
• EQing
• Compression and compression techniques, e.g. sidechaning
• Glitch/stutter effects
• Guitar effects
• Bass sound
• Useful tips/tricks/shortcuts
• DJing with Ableton Live
• Using Live for live performances
results.name: NYC Electronic Music Producers

results.description:
Hi moms (and dads)! My daughter, almost 3, is Chinese & Korean and just starting to talk up a storm. She sings songs in Chinese, counts to 10 in Korean but speaks mostly in English. I want to make sure she's fluent in every language but don't want to confuse her. I've got lots of questions and am surprised at how little there is out there to help our little ones along.

I created this meetup group to unite multilingual families and provide events where they can share info and experience to help each other succeed. I'm going to be organizing events with speakers who can tackle issues like when to introduce the 2nd or 3rd language and what is going on with the kids in their development at different ages. Speakers will also address the emotional and cultural issues within mixed ethnic background families.

My personal passion for this group stems from my own inability to converse in Korean. I can read and write Korean but my parents came from a generation that believed their kids wouldn't succeed in English if they were taught Korean. I cannot converse with my relatives, only their children who grew up here speaking English. I can speak French better than Korean which I learned in high school. This has frustrated me all my life. I believe that children are sponges and very capable of several languages, and in this changing world isn't it necessary? I'd just like to help make it as easy and fun as possible. Anyone with me? Monica
results.name: NYC Moms of Multilingual Squirts (MOMS)

Some of the meetups hosted are completely free or are on a suggested donation base, while other meetings require a fee.  All funds collected support the Vimukti Yoga Mission, and the instructors contribute by donating their time and skills to the events.

results.description:
Success Circles is a community of empowered individuals who are playing
a big game in life. Our aim for this group is support each other to be highly
effective and have fun without compromising our values.

Success Circles is uniquely designed knowing the challenges most entrepreneurs
and job seekers are facing; staying engaged toward their goals, avoiding distractions,
while not having the structures that a corporate environment might have provided.

At our monthly meetings, you will be exposed to the most cutting-edge performance,
time management and productivity strategies including concepts from David Allen,
Steven Covey, Tony Robbins, Julie Morgenstern, Tony Schwartz, Tim Ferriss and Brian
Tracy.

You’ll learn how to be proactive, use effective leveraging and that the key to success
and happiness is not about being a “human doing” machine. We want you to have a
balanced life, working with your personal energy cycles, and have more fun.

Your fundamental quality and experience of time will shift. The Webster’s dictionary
may define time as a measurable period. You’ll personally begin to recognize that
time can be more of an emotion or feeling. By bringing your focus on what counts,
most especially your victories, joy, and gratitude, you’ll find yourself having more time
to do what you love.

You’ll get to the important 20 % that will get you closer to the results that you want,
instead of the 80% busy work that occupies too much time and energy for most people.

Let's Take it to the Max!
~Joseph
results.name: Success Circles

results.description:
We are looking for hikers over 40 years old who want to explore all the great trails NJ has to offer. Most of the hikes will be in NJ or on the NY border, 4-5 hours long, 6 to 10 miles, and of moderate to strenuous difficulty.  The hikes will mostly take place on Saturdays or Sundays

Meetup Rules: This is a social event and not a guided hike. As
such you are responsible for understanding and following all
laws within the park. You accept responsibility for the safety of yourself,  and any
friends you invite from outside the group. Attending this event
signifies you understand the physical challenges and agree that
you  are physically capable and that you will be
responsible for your own safety.  Please note that dogs are not allowed on our hikes.

Please post your photo when you sign up- it is very helpful for the leaders to identify people on their hikes.

  • Only one guest is allowed per member, otherwise the hikes are members only
  • Attendance size may  be limited depending on the venue and parking etc.
  • Hiking is always at your own risk, but please wear appropriate clothing, hiking boots or shoes.
  • Always bring enough water for yourself.
  • Arrive on time or even early so the hike can start as promptly as possible.
  • No informal, unplanned hikes are allowed.  The hike must be on the calendar, and must have a host.

    Please let the organizers know if you have any suggestions for a hike.
results.name: NJ  Forty Plus Hiking Club

What is Co Working ?

results.description:
Have you asked yourself, "Where are the individuals rocking vegetarianism, veganism and very cool ideas in the Mile Square City and the JC?"

 

If you have, welcome to V Rock! The Hoboken + Jersey City Vegetarian + Vegan Meetup where men and women rock connection over conscious, delicious cuisine to create positive change for ourselves, our cities, animals and Earth.

 

We're a tribe from all walks of life - V-Rockers - vegetarians, vegans and the very cool - who strive to be conscious and compassionate, make choices to live healthier, expect the best of our towns and befriend authentic, inspiring individuals.

 

Here are some things we're all thinking about for Hoboken and Jersey City:

- Who are the other vegetarian and vegan foodies in our area? 

- Who wants to rock veggies together at restaurants and potlucks?

- What ideas, plans and things are folks rocking to create positive change?

- What Hoboken and Jersey City restaurants have great vegetarian and vegan food?

- How can we convince Hoboken and Jersey City restaurants to offer more or better vegetarian and vegan cuisine, as well as substitutes for dairy, eggs and gluten?

- How can we band together to inspire ourselves to live our best, most conscious life—from what we eat, to how we live, to what we buy, to how we travel, to how we help and to what our cities should be doing to make change possible?

 

Each one of us has come to a vegetable, fruit and nut-based diet from different paths, whether it's compassion for all beings, concern for the planet, improving our health, living longer lives, getting into top athletic form, following in the footsteps of our heroes or leaving a legacy for those we love.

 

And each of us are at different places along our paths, whether vegetarian, vegan, veg-cuisine enthusiast or veg-hmmm, but there's one thing we share: a drive to conquer and improve our bodies, our conscience and our consciousness, rock our worlds, abandon stale ideas and adopt ones that replace harm and suffering with help and joy—and, ultimately, help us to achieve individual greatness, collective wisdom and universal kindness.

 

Please join V Rock! The Hoboken + Jersey City Vegetarian + Vegan Meetup  to meet others looking for authentic, inspiring friendships with the like-minded. Together, we'll rock veggies, whether in restaurants or in each other's kitchens, rock ideas, plans and things creating positive change, share information on what good restaurants or organizations are doing good things and, of course, rock our towns!

 

Any V-Rocker can organize a meetup, so please don't hesitate!
 

Please RSVP for meetups!

 

V Rock Hoboken and Jersey City! We Rock Hoboken and Jersey City!
results.name: V Rock! The Hoboken + Jersey City Vegetarian + Vegan Meetup

results.description:
We are a group of sincere, warm-hearted Buddhist practitioners studying Mahayana & Vajrayana Buddhism. We provide newcomers to Buddhism as well as established practitioners an opportunity to study, cultivate, learn practices, and meditate.

Buddhism provides us with tools to discover the true nature of reality as we analyze and reflect upon our lives to understand the causes and conditions that shape the world around us, discover how to uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns, and learn how to cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind.

We study teachings and learn ancient practices that show us how to:

  • Purify negative karma and cultivate pure positive karma
  • Remove inner and outer obstacles that block worldly and spiritual goals
  • Uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns
  • Meditate and cultivate a stable mind
  • Train the mind in loving-kindness and compassion
  • Cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind

Our deep explorations of Mahayana and Vajrayana Buddhism through cultivation practices, discussions and meditation are shaped by ongoing teachings of Lama Namnang Mingjo Dorje Rinpoche, a humble but highly cultivated Chinese Vajrayana yogi, as well as various Tibetan Buddhist teachers.

So come join a friendly group as we support each other in this essential journey, both through online communication and face-to-face meetings. We look forward to meeting you. Let's enjoy this journey!

Peace,

Michelle, Pailin and Susan
results.name: Developing a Peaceful Mind: Buddhist Meditation for Everyday

results.description:
As a second generation, Staten Island breast cancer survivor with a daughter raised on Staten Island, breast cancer education and support is near and dear to my heart.

 I am a breast cancer survivor of 4 years. April 11, 2011 was my 4th year anniversity. My mom was a breast cancer survivor of over 40 years, unfortunately she died last summer.  I was in my early 20's and a college student when she was diagnosed. My daughter was only 15 and a high school student when I was diagnosed. I remembered as a young woman how devastating this disease was to me and my family. I watched mom who sufferred from clinical depression spiral deeper into a depression that was absolutely terrifying and wondered if this was the face of breast cancer.

 My dad believing he was helping did not allow the Reach to Recovery Volunteers visit mom nor were we allowed to speak about her cancer, her mastectomy or her depression. As a young college student I feared not only would I be diagnosed with breast cancer one day but I too would not be able to navigate the disease, medically or psychologically or have a full recovery.

 As a psychotherapist specializing in trauma, especially women's issues, I vowed this would be different for my daughter when I was diagnosed. I had treated many women diagnosed with breast cancer throughout my career but now I had to personalize it. I designed a Mind/Body Program for my own initial recovery and now wish to create a support meetup group for educational, recreational and supportive activities.
results.name: Moving Ahead in the Pink- S.I.'s Breast- Cancer Group

results.description:
The Northwestern Queens Paranormal Research Group (NQPRG) has recently been named as one of the top two paranormal meetups in the metro region by meetup.com. We were beat out of number one by a group of UFO Enthusiasts. Isn't it crazy what some people believe? None-the-less, that makes us the number one meetup dedicated to exploring the afterlife.

This is a group for individuals in the Tri-state region who are interested in exploring all aspects of the afterlife and those parts of nature that some perceive  and understand as being "paranormal". The NQPRG, on the other hand, considers that certain things that others label paranormal are perfectly normal parts of nature and as such we seek them out, explore them, and do our best to interpret the events that we encounter.

The NQPRG is a collective of Professional Paranormal Research Groups (PRGs), Paranormal Investigative Teams (PITs), Individuals Researchers (of all levels of expertise), those with special physical and mental gifts, and enthusiasts that want to learn about the paranormal and  to become investigators or develop their gifts themselves.

Our only rule is that a member must strictly adhere to the scientific method and be willing and able to apply critical thinking skills in order to truly understand the phenomena that we have experienced either individually or through group investigations/meetups.

While The NQPRG is primarily a Paranormal Investigative Team, our mission is to reach out to as many people interested in the paranormal through educational outreach. We bring together the beginner and the experienced as we explore the paranormal together. We do this by providing free workshops in basic and advanced paranormal investigation techniques and spiritual development. We brings together various paranormal professionals and enthusiasts who can share experiences and techniques.

Apart from monthly social gatherings where we will discuss our experiences and compare investigation notes, we will also explore various free and low cost venues where we can conduct investigations and explore the paranormal and supernatural aspects of the Greater New York/Tri-state Metro Area. All  NQPRG all events will FREE to all members and friends of the meetup.

Your humble organizer,

Bradley

“…Try as man might  ghosts can’t be explained away, nor will they disappear. They continue to appear frequently all over the world, to young and old, to rich and poor, in old houses and in new, on airports and in streets, and where ever tragedy strikes man"
—Douglas Hill
results.name: Northwestern Queens Paranormal Research Group (NQPRG)

results.description:
Libertarians: We are not primarily political, we simply respect
property rights and thus live by a code of non-aggression. Property
rights are sacred to us because civilization is built on social
cooperation and social cooperation is only made possible by the clear
delineation and respect of property rights.

Entrepreneurs: in a general sense, we are the creative and energetic
members of society seeking to produce value; weather it be economic,
social or personal.

The Society of Libertarian Entrepreneurs brings like minded people
together for the direct benefit of networking and socializing. The
Society seeks to create opportunities for members to be more
economically successful and productive. The Society also seeks to
cultivate a culture of excellence and camraderie among members. We see
the success of individual libertarians, in mind, body, wealth and in
our network as directly related to our ability to enjoy life and
protect ourselves from aggression.﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

As M﻿ises writes:
" The body of economic knowledge is an essential element in the structure of human civilization; it is the foundation upon which modern industrialism and all the moral, intellectual, technological, and therapeutical achievements of the last centuries have been built. It rests with men whether they will make the proper use of the rich treasure with which this knowledge provides them or whether they will leave it unused. But if they fail to take the best advantage of it and disregard its teachings and warnings, they will not annul economics; they will stamp out society and the human race." - Ludwig Von Mises, Human Action
results.name: The Society of Libertarian Entrepreneurs (NYC)

results.description:
Our mission is to prevent and ultimately end forced labor and sexual exploitation of men, women, and children. We raise awareness in communities through hosting educational events and speaking engagements. We collaborate with government agencies and non-governmental organizations to establish acceptable preventive measures, identify victims, expose traffickers and users, and promote slave-free practices. We provide funding for programs that support survivors of human trafficking through medical assistance, vocational training and economical development, so that survivors are better prepared to re-enter society.

 

Slavery still exists; it is just better hidden today than it was in the past. In fact, there are currently more human slaves in the world than ever before in history – an estimated 27 million adults and 13 million children around the world are victims of human trafficking. Every year, over a million men, women, and children fall into the hands of traffickers, in their own countries and abroad. Human trafficking is a crime against humanity. It deprives people of their human rights and freedoms, it is a global health risk, and it fuels organized crime. Victims are used for a range of exploitative purposes - sexual exploitation, forced labor, organ harvesting, and combat fighting, among many others.

 

The Human Trafficking Awareness (HTA) Council was founded to fight against this horrific evil and we are asking for your help. Only together, we can make a difference. We are looking for volunteers that would like to help us, in support of humanity, to raise awareness of this devastating reality.

 

Regardless of your background or expertise, there is a place for you in the HTA Council and we need your support. There is so much we can do with just a few small commitments from everybody. Together, we can create a movement to combat human trafficking on a global level, and provide a voice for its victims.

Join Us:

www.Twitter.com/HTACouncil 
www.YouTube.com/HTACouncil
www.Facebook.com
results.name: The Human Trafficking Awareness Council

results.description:
The goal of this meetup group is make good short films. Filmmaking is not an easy task and requires people who are dedicated to the art form and willing to work hard to improve in their craft. With that said, you can only learn so much about filmmaking from reading books (which is helpful in its own right), or going to film school (very expensive/time intensive)... but the best way is improve is to get involved in the whole process numerous times (Director Robert Rodriguez made thirty shorts before making his first full length feature, El Mariachi ). Numerous successful filmmakers all say the same thing, go out there and keep making movies. It is our hope that by repeatedly making good little films, with tiny or non-existent budgets, we will become better in this craft. So bring what talent you have and more importantly, your passion, ideas and creativity to our meetups and let’s see what we can do.

In addition to the previous points, we actually produce content. We have shot 13 film shorts since April 2011, several of which are entered in festivals and contests (see our Short films Completed page and Production Photos). We don't just talk the talk but walk the walk. We are not interested in having endless meetings, we want to produce good little films and we are looking for members who will do what is necessary to produce a good film.

Special Appeal to Screenwriters: We especially would like to see writers show up to our meetings because it is your stories we are trying to shoot. If you have an appealing short that you would like to see made, why not submit it? The scripts we select are usually done by group vote. Once it is selected, we will do our best to bring it to life in a way that does justice to your story.

Important information for Actors: We provide the raw video clips of to all actors as well as a copy of the finished short for your reel. As put by a casting director,"Not having [a current actors reel] absolutely decreases an actor's chances of getting hired. It looks like you've never worked in film or television. And what better way to see how an actor looks on film than to see their reel?"
- Mark Sikes, casting director

8/13/11 Update : Our 2nd film "The Mark" was ranked in the top ten at the 72hour Film Shootout 2011, not bad for a new film group.

12/20/12 Our film short "DreamSellers" was an official selection for the Hopeful Story Film Festival held in BH Photo.

See it and all our films on our Youtube Channel. (Note: we cannot post all our films because of festival restrictions. As they finish their festival run, we will post them on our Channel.)

Join us!
results.name: NYC Filmmakers and Actors Meetup

results.description:
Open to all those looking to find more wisdom, love, inner peace and spiritual freedom in their lives, through better understanding of dreams, past lives and the personal way the universe speaks to us daily. Move naturally and easily into higher areas of awareness and help life flow in a smoother and happier direction. One form of personal meditation we explore is known as a "Spiritual Exercise". This form of simple meditation, using your creative imagination, strengthens your inner guidance and helps you recognize your true identity as Soul, an eternal and divine spark of God.

Nothing needs to be taken on faith. Experience it yourself.

Have you had one of the following spiritual experiences? Come and share; learn more about connecting to direct guidance and achieving personal growth.

* Past-life recall or having a sense that you have lived before (in a meditation or dream)

* Dreams -- that opened awareness, expanded your consciousness, told of a future event, gave you an answer

* Out-of-body or near death experience * Seeing an inner light

* Hearing an inner sound

* Inner guidance (angel, spiritual master, departed loved one)

* Knowingness (intuition, coincidence, déjà vu)

* Unconditional love (from a family member, friend, pet, etc.)

* Sense of oneness, divine love

* Connection with all life -- greater awareness, feeling of inner peace

Creative techniques are discussed in these Meetups to further explore our inner worlds. Similar to meditation, yet more active, these contemplation techniques, such as singing the ancient love song to God, HU, (pronounced 'hue") helps with self improvement, brings self empowerment through greater inner understanding, opens consciousness, helps in understanding how karma is created, how to work through it, and gives guidance on how to achieve states of Self and God Realization.

HU, this ancient and sacred word for God, can be found in the Jewish Kabala, Christian Gregorian chant, Buddhism, the Sufi teachings, Chinese Taoism, as well as in the path of Eckankar. It is a universal word with a very high vibration. You are invited to try it anytime you would like, either out loud or silently to experience the effects for yourself. (www.Hear.HU.org)

We warmly welcome you to join us in our events and discussions that take place in all 5 boroughs, Westchester and Rockland – a common meeting ground for all who have had or would like to have a life-changing spiritual experience.

Our group is sponsored by Eckankar. Experience the Light and Sound of God. This ancient spiritual teaching offers spiritual techniques and resources for an individual to discover truth for themselves.

To learn more about Eckankar, go to www.Eckankar.org Learn more about this Meetup Group, Eckankar, advanced study and the spiritual exercises.
results.name: Past Lives, Dreams, Soul Travel throughout New York

results.description:
The Script Revision Workshop begins Wednesday, June 15 and continues for 8 weeks. Classes meet from 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM at 440 Studios, 440 Lafayette Street. The cost is $495.00

Why: I know the excitement of being in a screenwriting workshop and chipping away at a screenplay until you find what is essential. I will share with you the tremendous insight and training I received from the celebrated faculty at Columbia University’s graduate film program, while studying for my MFA degree.

When I receive feedback on my own scripts, I often feel that some of the comments are rather obvious. Why didn't I see that? Even more helpful are the notes about what is confusing, unmotivated, and arbitrary. We all become absorbed in our work and can lose the perspective needed to evaluate our screenplays. This Revision Workshop is designed for you – the writer, who wants to further develop your screenplay.

In all of the screenwriting, directing, and producing classes I have taken at Columbia, at the core of each class is the underlying script. Without that, there is no eventual film. Workshop classes, where students bring in early drafts of scripts, can be intimidating, at first. We think to ourselves, “I sweated and slaved to write this draft. I know it’s good. I don’t want someone else’s criticism!” That’s all valid, up to a point.

Despite the solitary hours – and hours – we all spend writing, in the end, a final screenplay is actually a result of input from several people. Eventually we want to hand over the cleanest, purest expression of our story to an agent, manager, producer, or director. I know the excitement of sitting in class and hear someone suggest a new idea to incorporate into someone else’s script. Where did that come from? How much more dramatic is the story if I increase the obstacles, and actually make it harder for the protagonist to achieve his goal?

Together, the class will offer ideas, opinions, and suggestions – all to help you write the story you intend. Sometimes the best ideas come from listening to what is said about another’s person’s screenplay. As needed, the class will also consist of a review of the fundamentals of screenplay craft, including structure, conflict, character development, and exposition. Also, tools to begin revising a script and a clear approach to completing the next draft will be clearly articulated. Class participants will have the opportunity to present their work at least twice, and will be encouraged to offer their work for review more frequently.

A little about me: I am award-winning screenwriter and received my MFA degree from the School of the Arts at Columbia University. Prior to returning to school, I had worked in film and theatre as a writer, director and producer for close to 15 years, and am the author of several screenplays and stage plays. I currently have a screenplay in development. My spec script, “30 Rock: Seeing is Believing,” was recognized as a Faculty Select, in addition to being awarded Best Teleplay, as part of the 2009 Columbia University Film Festival. "The Prion Complex" is a finalist for the Columbia University/Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Screenwriting Award. I have also graduated of the University of Pennsylvania, the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of the Law and am the Artistic Director of East Park Productions, a not-for-profit company devoted to the development of new works for film and theatre.

When: This 8-week workshop begins on Wednesday, June 15 and continues through Wednesday, August 3.

Time: Each class meets from 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM.

Fee: $495.00.

Where: Class meets at 440 Studios, 440 Lafayette Street, across from the Public Theater. Convenient to the N/R and 6 subway lines.

Additional information: Please visit www.valsherman.com for complete information.

results.description:
The Christian Party of America (www.christianpartyonline.com) is a new, national third-party of Christian voters, dedicated to proclaiming that Jesus is Lord in the political arena. Our purpose is to bring our country back to being an unabashedly Christian nation, by offering and electing competent candidates who share and promote our vision. Please join us in our goal of uniting believers under the banner of Jesus Christ to bring constitutional freedom to all people of the United States. We believe in the Christian principles set forth in the Bible, the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and the Declaration of Independence.

The Christian Party of America is under the leadership of our founder and National Chairman, Clell Drumheller. We currently have affiliates in a number of states including Texas (www.cptx.us), Louisiana (www.cpofla.org), Florida, Georgia, Arizona, Massachuttes, and North Carolina (www.ChristianPartyNC.com).  North Carolina also has a publicity video about restoring our country's Christian heritage at:  www.youtube.com/user/ChristianPartyNC#p/a/u/1/76lh47z0v9I. 

To join the Christian Party of America you can use the Membership form in the "Files" section of this Meetup group.

The National Advisory Board of the Christian Party of America is focused on building affiliates in other states including New York.  We invite you to contact any of the National Advisory Board members for more information.

The National Advisory Board

1) Clell Drumheller: (Texas) National Chairman of the Christian Party of America, State Chairman of the Christian Party of Texas. Email: Chair@CPTX.us Phone: 866-278-3927

2) Don R. Watson: (NC) State Chairman of the Christian Party of North Carolina, Email: nccpexecdirector@nc.rr.com Phone: 919-753-7583

3) Earl Grover: (NC) National Director of the Christian Men in Leadership Division and the Veterans of the Constitution Divisions, NC Congressional District 7 Director, NC State Executive committee Board member Email: earlgrover@gmail.com

4) Larry Davis: (Florida) National Director of the Christian Truckers of America Division, Southeastern Seaboard Director of the Veterans for the Constitution Division of the Christian Party of America Email: davis32208@hotmail.com Phone: 904-624-9198

5) Katherine Bredehoeft: (NC) National Field Director of the Christian Party of America, Business Administrator of the Christian Party of North Carolina Email: BusinessOffice@ChristianPartyNC.com Phone: 877-844-6378

Principles of the Christian Party of America

1. 100 % Pro-Life, Pro-Liberty, and Pro-Private Property Ownership.

2. Complete National Sovereignty for the USA.

3. Maintain Strong National Defence of the actual interests of the United States, only. With this secure Our Borders, Interior, Language, and Culture, as well as Embrace Fair Trade Policy.

4. Return the Rule of Law to Our Nation – ending the Rule of Prominent Personalities and Unaccountable Entities that, currently, dominates.

5. Truly Constitutional, Limited Government – at all levels - according to the principles of Strict Construction and Original Intent.

6. Restore All Constitutional Rights and Protections to Citizens. US Constitutional Rights are, only, for Actual Citizens of the USA.

7. Restore Home Rule and States’ Rights and Sovereignty.

8. Rescind the 16th (concerning the Federal Personal Income Tax) and 17th (concerning the way U.S. Senators are elected) Amendments.

9. Eliminate all Taxes Other than Those Permitted in the Original Constitution and Practiced by the Nation’s Founders.

10. End Unconstitutional Government Spending -- and the Federal Reserve System -- and Return to Sound, Backed Money.

11. Congressional Reform.

12. Good Character, as determined by observed behaviour, on the Part of Those in Public Office, based on the standards of our Judeo-Christian heritage.

 

Not paid for by any candidate or candidate committee.
results.name: Christian Party of America (NY)

results.description:
NY Graph is a place for people to learn about and discuss graph structures, graph theory, graph databases and related topics. We host technical presentations and lectures, product demos, lightning talks, seminars, town hall-style open forums and hands-on tutorials, in addition to less-structured monthly gatherings.

Why graphs? Why now?
Graph structures and methods are being used everywhere. As the size of datasets being generated, processed, and presented continues to grow, the relative strengths and weaknesses of different data structures, including graphs, have become more and more significant in everyday applications. Meanwhile, wider awareness of graph concepts (thanks in large part to the popularity of online social networks and widespread adoption of machine learning techniques) has increased the use of graph methods in a variety of fields. As a result, the last few years have seen renewed interest in academic circles, and a large number of companies and independent efforts putting a great deal of effort into creating faster, more scalable, and more reliable graph databases and ever more powerful interfaces.

Why another meetup? Isn't [NoSQL NYC, etc.] enough?
We don't think so. There are many great NoSQL meetups, but the current pace of innovation in graph database technology and graph theory is such that keeping on top of developments requires an immense amount of dedication. Our intention is to save our members time, money, and effort by providing a venue for sharing domain-specific experiences and best practices, scheduling useful programs for people at all levels of knowledge and experience, and creating a strong local community around graphs.

Am I missing something? What are graphs?
The following Wikipedia entries provide a decent primer:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_(data_structure)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_database
results.name: NY Graph Meetup

results.description:
Make Meaningful Connections

What originally started as a forum (NYTechWomen) for women who were active and passionate about technology, quickly became so much more. Since May 2011, NYTechWomen has been changing the tech environment for women in NYC. In March 2013, it became incredibly clear that the environment needed to change for women outside of NYC as well, and Bella Minds was born. Publicly launching on October 17th with a crowdfunding campaign, 52 days later, after successfully raising $28,692 from 263 backers, we hit the road with our tried and tested curriculum. 

We’re very proud of the wonderful community we have all built together, first supporting New York women in technology, and now supporting all women interested in technology. 

There are now thousands of community members, but our elbows-down approach hasn't changed one bit. We're still having regular NYC-based events, continuing in the NYTechWomen tradition, but we've added many, many more programs as well. So, be sure to join us at our next event, and contact us if you are interested in helping us close the digital divide for even more women, taking the power of technology to every woman who wants it.

results.description:
Mindfulness Meditation utilizes the ancient art of Buddhist awareness and the insights of Science to address the enormously stressful times that we live in. Mindfulness is a part of everyone's experience and can be utilized to help us with: anxiety, depression and stress. Mindfulness also helps us cultivate greater resiliency for life's inevitable ups and downs.

Our suffering is real and no surprise with the speed and complexity of our lives as well as the stunning degree of change that our society and world are manifesting daily. It is no wonder that we are stressed out and our coping mechanisms are often at the limit of their effectiveness, which can make exhaustion a frequent experience.

This meetup is for those who are attracted to changing their relationship to stress via mindfulness meditation practices. Practices are taught with simplicity, without the contrivances of religious ritual. The group nourishes each person by allowing them to discover their own way via their own self-aware experience. There are 8 week classes, weekly meetings and one-day retreats. Please join us!

COST:  $5  (weekly sittings)

For information about Mindfulness Meditation and William Miller, Organizer

www.williammillerlcsw.com

www.heart-awakening.org

http://www.umassmed.edu/content.aspx?id=41252

Thanks,

William Miller LCSW

Our first Organizer Tania started this group because she was looking for support for partners and/or spouses of Aspies and found none. She found several services and groups for Aspies and parents of children with Autism Spectrum disorders, but none for adult partners. So she began this group hoping to meet others in the NYC/NJ area who face the same unique challenges of having a partner with Asperger Syndrome.

If you are in an AS/NT relationship please consider joining this group. Even if you are in a good place in your relationship, please come and be an inspiration for others. An AS/NT relationship is special and unique in it's challenges, but holds potential to be rewarding. The focus of this peer group will be on emotional and practical support as well as informational exchange. We can support each other to achieve the best in our relationships! :-)
