results.description:
Enjoy life more.

Find your inner peace. Cultivate self-awareness. Discover lasting happiness.

Yes, you CAN do all of this ... even with the challenges of everyday life.

That's what this group is all about.

At the all-new "SOAR in the NOW" Meetup, we cultivate a healthy and stress-free way of life by helping each other experience and celebrate the power of now.

Our events include mindfulness meditation sessions where you can learn how to meditate and enjoy the many benefits of mindfulness in your life.

We also host dynamic workshops based on inspiring works from contemporary spiritual teachers.

For the first two years of our group, we were called "Living With Tolle." Our guiding teacher was Eckhart Tolle (known for his best sellers "The Power of Now" and "A New Earth").

In the upcoming year, we'll experience new teachings, new practices, and new events.

We'll get together for savory dinners, nature hikes, dynamic talks with guest speakers, and inspiring workshops and retreats.

We always include time to meet new friends and to share your journey and experiences. Indeed, many deep and lasting friendships have been born in our events.

 

ABOUT LEO, THE GROUP ORGANIZER


Eckhart Tolle's teachings and the practice of mindfulness meditation have completely transformed the way I experience life.

I created this group to share what I have learned with a community of people who are seeking self-awareness, greater joy, and inner peace in their daily lives.

I am a long time educator, artist, and meditation coach. I am the proud father of 3 beautiful children who are my favorite spiritual teachers.

Learn more about me.

My workshops, podcasts, and classes have helped thousands of people world-wide reduce stress, improve their sleep, control their emotions, nurture better relationships, and feel better about their lives.

Read testimonials about my programs.

THANK YOU FOR READING THIS FAR!

You're probably still here because you're curious. Perhaps you are looking to make new friends. You might be experiencing stress or challenging situations in your life. Maybe you're just seeking deeper sense of what it all means, a sense of purpose.

Maybe you've actually found your path. Amazing teachings. Spiritual wisdom. Wonderful practices that have helped you, guided you, and inspired you.

Maybe, like me, you're excited to share these with like-minded people. With new friends that will support your personal growth. With great people who will inspire you even more!

Welcome home. You've come to the right group.

Our members are a fantastic group of kind, friendly, and generous people from all backgrounds and life situations.

Over the last two years, we've come together with one common goal: to discover and share ways to live more dynamic and peaceful lives by cultivating presence, joy, and kindness within ourselves and for the world.

So if this sounds like something you'd like to experience, discover, and share, then Click "Join" and RSVP for our next great event.

Come SOAR with us!

I look forward to seeing you,

Leo

Founder, InnerPeaceTeachings.com
Producer, LivingWithTolle.com

 

S O A R !
results.name: SOAR in the NOW: Living with Presence, Peace and Joy!

results.description:
AXA Equitable Toastmasters Club is a local chapter of Toastmasters International which is a world leader in communication and leadership development where members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending meeting to practice first hand.

Our meetings begin promptly at 5:45pm on the 2nd & 4th Wednesday of every month at the following address:

Adobe Systems
1540 Broadway - 17th floor (at West 45th Street)
New York, NY 10036

In order to gain access to the meetings you will need to sign up on this site and provide your full name as it will appear on a photo ID.

Our meetings are a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. There is no instructor. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure. Members learn communication skills by working in the Competent Communication manual, a series of 10 self-paced speaking assignments designed to instill a basic foundation in public speaking.
results.name: AXA Equitable Toastmasters Club

results.description:
We are the Source for Multifamily & Commercial Real Estate Resources in The Five Boro's, Suburbs of New York City and North Jersey .

We will have twice a month meetings so that you can make the business connections you need, get financing on yor next project, meet Realtors who have that next Income Producing property you are looking for and realize your dreams of owning investment properties!

*******************************************************

Come out and meet the right connections through this savvy investor networking group. These entrepreneurs are focused on building wealth through cash flow rental income in commercial, apartment, multifamily, and residential property, including distressed assets and foreclosures. Create opportunities, find private money, network, and learn how to put together deals correctly.

We’ll focus on beginning and advanced strategies and business opportunities in the commercial & apartment building markets throughout the country, but also local to New York. We provide a forum in New York (NYC) for real estate investors to partner up together. We are adamant about doing the right thing in this industry that has had so many wrongs done.

We want to help facilitate discussion and the exchange of different investor perspectives, and share successful tactics and strategies the leadership team has applied in both the residential and commercial investing arenas. Join us on now on Meetup to discover our next roundtable discussion, find our LIVE meetings throughout New York, and learn about what you need to know to actually make money through Real Estate! You will also gain invitations to our private networking events, presentations, and conference calls to discuss strategies and current investment deals.

All investors, from new to very experienced, are welcome! Don't miss any of our live events! There is always something to learn, investment opportunities to participate in, networking with some of the local (and national) best real estate professionals & more! If you have a topic you are completely versed in and want to share it in a live setting with our group email us today and we can make it happen. If you have a real estate related question and you want a solution...get in touch with us today!

A small person-shaped figure used as a player's token in a board game. Welcome to The Tipsy Meeple!

Scrabble, Monopoly, Clue? So 50 years ago! Come explore the new world of board gaming with fun modern games! This is a social group who enjoy playing strategy and party games! Come learn new games like Dominion, Cosmic Encounter, The Resistance and more!

We meet weekly and are always excited to have new people join our group!  Bring your favorite games or come play some of ours!  Don't be shy if you've never heard of any of the games we play, because many of our members had their first experiences with modern board games right here in this group, and they keep coming back every week!

Our group meets at a bar in Boonton, NJ and our members are a wide mix of people.  Gay, straight, married, single: you name it and we've got it!  We are an accepting and inviting group and can't wait for you to join us!

So get off your couch and come enjoy a night out of laughing, drinking, and playing the best board games you've ever played!  We are waiting for you!

We meet every other Friday at 7pm (excluding Holiday weekends)

Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise.

10 Session Program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities. Make a reservation for a Free Trial Visit.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating.  The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed.  We offer a more humane and effective alternative.  Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out.  We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.
results.name: NYC Acting Classes

results.description:
With all of us being on the bleeding edge of this first true social networking medium there seems like is a lot of interesting applications it could be used for.

I think it would be great to have some question and answer between developers, community groups that would like to use Google+ to help build local connections, regular users and any other movers and shakers in the Google+ Scene to try to flesh out some of the unknowns about it while everyone is still in the trial stage of all of this.

Was originally trying to just "suggest" this idea of a Meetup to the Google Tech Talks Group, and with such overwhelming response thought it might be best to start it up as it's own Meetup. So if you signed up there before, signup here now, even if you can't make this first Meetup.

Feel free to post you profile (or don't if you want to be more private) on the discussion boards along with any questions you might have. We can work to find the answers (or the answerers) together. Or if you have an idea for a feature put it up there too so we can compile a big list to submit to Google together and find strength in numbers.

 

The first Meeting I'm thinking we should try to ask these basic questions and then see where we want to go in the future:

What sorts of uses have you found for Google+ So Far?

What would you like to do once the API comes out?

What are some features you LOVE in Google+? Hate? Wish were being added?

Anybody you'd like to come to talk at this or a future Meetup?

Any type of person we should be reaching out for more (ie developers, people in business, people who are famous in tech blogging)?

Any Groups we should partner with?

 

If you'd like to help organize, or have any contacts contact me via my Google Profile, and add me to a circle!

https://plus.google.com/u/0/101148713477259547247
results.name: NYC Google Plus Interest Group

results.description:
More than just an Italian language class, In Italiano is a get-together for people interested in Italian culture and in learning the language in a fun, informal social setting. Led by Stefano, an instructor from Rome with over 15 years of experience teaching New Yorkers to speak Italian, in the class you will have the opportunity to make new friends as you practice your conversational skills, polish your pronunciation, build up your vocabulary, and finally figure out those verb conjugations!

The meetings are divided into Beginners/Advanced beginners; Intermediate and Intermediate Advanced students.

We will typically meet in two different locations.

The first and the last Wednesday of the month we meet in Tribeca at Space on White http://www.spaceonwhite.com/, 81 White Street (Btw. Broadway & Lafayette)from 6 to 8pm for conversation classes on specific topics. The class consists mostly of conversation, reading, and occasionally we will watch videos or, if we have time for long sessions, watch a movie and try to have a conversation about it afterwards. Each week the conversation theme will change, and will focus on vocabulary that will be advantageous to anyone hoping to learn the language for travel and social purposes. We will emphasize conversation centered on art, film, culture, current events, and Italian history.

The second and last Sunday of the month we meet for an Art walk in Italian at the Metropolitan Museum, each month a different topic. We meet at the museum, next to the info booth at 1045 and usually the walk lasts 2 hours. The Art walk are an amazing opportunity to talk about art and feelings in Italian with a knowledgeable and enthusiastic group of students.

Spero proprio di vederti e di parlarti presto :)

Ciao!
results.name: In Italiano - Italian Language Classes and seminars

The club’s event format includes a keynote speaker’s startup success and failure story, and one hour of resource exchange where each attendee presents short ‘gives’ and ‘asks’. This event meshes innovators in social and green enterprise, technology and Corporate Social Responsibility. Green Breakfast Club aims to become THE resource hub for local green business communities worldwide.

Who should attend: Entrepreneurs, Innovators, CSR professionals, Intrapraneurs, Developers, Technologies, Green Enthusiasts, Creators, Do-ers, Nonprofit Executives, Corporate Executives who want to 'go green', Sustainability Professionals, Cleantech Entrepreneurs, Startup Founders, Impact Investors, Social Entrepreneurs.

Green Breakfast Club

results.description:
Welcome to LivingPowerfully Community!

 

There has been a lot happening recently outside of the group as all organizers have been traveling for more intense trainings in practicums, workshops, and out of country seminars and it's time to bring it together, offer as much support and empowerment as we can with each other, and share in the enjoyment of life, creating the best we're able, together!

There are a variety of choices we have to start some weekly / bi-weekly / or monthly meetups and I want to find out what YOU are most interested in, what you want to attend, what you want to learn and practice, what you want to share....

Please share your preferences for meeting days/times and frequency. We'll host a number of try-outs for you so you won't lose out on anything. 

Meetups can be tailored for consciousness, awareness, better health and immunity, nutrition, relationships, stress-relief, body-awareness and pain-reduction, conflict-resolution, finding your passion and purpose in life, creative arts, raising children, and much more!

Begin your best journey now.. Read through and let us know what excites you, what motivates you, give us suggestions and feedback as we go so we can all help each other become the joyful, healthy, and helpful people we are all capable of being!

 

Some ideas and brief descriptions of practices possible:

 

Raja Yoga - to expand consciousness, practices of meditation and few asanas starting with the most basic. focus is on cultivating mind power and awareness.

 

Arahaj Yoga / Inner Martial Arts for emotional, psychological strength, raising immunity, protecting and cultivating a state of higher emotions and awareness of surroundings. Great for stress-relief, breath control, consciousness in all you do, a great compliment to regular yoga or martial arts practices. Dynamic. Controlled and focused explosions. Awareness of your energetic state (how you feel, where you feel what, how your environment is affecting you, how to not feel drained after meetings, phone calls, long travel, long days at the office, etc). We're also trained in some more well-known asana yoga traditions and martial arts traditions. If you're interested, jam session, but aharaj yoga is a bit different so you'll have to come and experience this ancient tradition that is pre-preparation for stressful meetings, jury duty, sports competitions, long-time meditations, and exam time.

See a teaser-trailer for Aharaj Yoga

 

Dynamic Dance Meditation - dance, move, stand still, lie down, and sweat it out. Guided and free-form dancing to practice different states of being - play and dance out different emotions, release fears, get exercise, meet great people, learn to use and harmonize excess energy or increase your energy, strength, and immunity. 

 

Energetic Theater - sort of a blend of expressive arts/drama therapy and dynamic meditation based in ancient and modern psychology, sociology, and empowerment theories that help us to understand different roles we play in our daily lives, how to recognize roles others play, and how to consciously choose appropriate roles with each other. Great for relationships - intimate, familial, business, creative....Changes situations with joy, laughter, and ease! Promotes understanding, peace, collaboration.

 

3 Nutrition - A holistic look at what nutrition really is and how you can feel more nourished, satiated, and live a healthier lifestyle through paying attention to your breathing, the food you eat, different rhythms and cycles/personal needs, and impressions you receive . Many nutrition paths from ancient to modern times and from a variety of cultures are integrated. Deep understanding of many food preferences, allergies, etc. 

 

Raw Food Dinner Parties- Not just raw food, also includes ayurveda, macrobiotics, and more, but a lot of knowledge on why fresh, organic, sprouted, local foods really are healthy for you! We can even prepare in front of you for you to taste and experience!

 

Self Healing Massage and Exercises - Practices to stimulate your immunity, get rid of pain, relax and rejuvenate your body. The primary thing you need is the time, space, and will power to help yourself. Then, it's just a matter of coming, practicing, and doing what feels right to you at home, in the park, on the train, or on a plane, or even in the passenger seat of the car (and heck, in the parking lot of your favorite grocery store too, why not?)

 

Neuropsychology - Teaching and Learning Education methods that you can use in educational settings or in the office, in a church, with a beloved partner, or in a nonprofit, even in a courtroom. Learn to become aware of your language and listen to what others are saying and transmitting through both their words and their body language, as well through behaviors. Take a deeper look at your real goals and plans and take stock of where you currently are in regards to your truest talents - even those talents that maybe you don't yet know about!

 

Creative Arts - Everyone has unique talents. We are not often supported in fully growing, perfecting, and utilizing our talents, but in these meet ups we are going to unleash our creative sides and learn what we can do with these talents - how the arts heal - empower - inspire,  how to unlock very great mental power most people never tap into, how we can create a new world of possibilities through drawing, sewing, molding clay, painting, acting, crawling in sand, or playing music...

 

We're all about becoming stronger, healthier, happier, more empowered, more free, more flexible, less inhibited by patterns, fears, low emotions, unconsciously motivated ideas that are not personally and thoroughly tested and thought through.

We don't believe we need substances to have a good time either so we'll be offering some really healthy alternatives through pot lucks, juice and smoothie tastings, and heck... maybe we'll manage to arrange all night dance parties, philosophical hikes, or biking journeys with friendly organic pillow battles from time to time just to bring out the inner child and get to know each other better

;-)

Whatever the meeting or adventure, we're excited for you to come join us on a journey of empowerment, joy, learning, practice... or just take a taste of delightful, delicate, and sweet relaxation, rejuvenating knowledge, and environments that promote stress-relief in and of themselves. 

Thoughtfully and meaningfully, 

Your Living Powerfully Organizers!

 

P.S. We're all down to earth, friendly, reliable individuals who have pretty cool personalities, extensive backgrounds in various fields, and the energy and experience to create meaningful meetups and events, so so if you're sitting there and thinking of reaching out to ask more, inquire, make a suggestion, or tell us what you're doing and most interested in, know that we're here and ready to hear from you!

 

ABOUT INSTRUCTORS:

Joshua Duncan is a student & teacher in traditions of human excellence and mastery. He leads empowerment workshops & classes ~ and offers personal one on one counsel, healing, & transformation work.

His Study and Background

  • Intensive study living in Peru with a Shaman and his family
  • 3 Years Training in Meditation Centers & Buddhist Monasteries
  • Over a year’s time in Silent Retreat
  • Living as an Ordained Novice Buddhist Monk
  • Study with Native American Wisdom Tradition Holder
  • Training in Russia with Siberian Shaman
  • Intensive study & travel with Aharaj Yoga Master - One of the longest studying American students of Aharaj Yoga, Joshua was one of the first teachers in the States to teach this practice in parks and yoga studios.
  • Current student of a Master of Raja Yoga

Joshua has received initiation in an ancient form of tibetan healing & has blessing to teach the way of Health, Harmony, and Happiness.

 

Erika Henson is dedicated to helping people live happy, healthy, balanced lifestyles. She assists people to find their unique path and quickly change their lives, finding harmony and success. She continuously trains and travels internationally with teachers and healers sharing transformational knowledge from classical tantra, raja yoga, spiritual astrology, cultural dance, and systems of ancient martial arts.

Erika received her BA in Individualized Studies from New York University completing a program combining neuropsychology, relationship psychology, ethnopediatrics, and creative arts therapies. She is in progress of receiving her MA/PhD at Pacifica Graduate Institute in Mythological Studies and Depth Psychology. She is a self-healing educator trained at the School for Self Healing, a children’s yoga teacher and anusara-inspired adult yoga teacher, nutritional consultant with training from the Open Center for Holistic Health in NYC, and experience in Energy Kinesiology for stress relief with training from the International College of Healing Arts.

A dancer by heart with great enthusiasm for living freely, Erika hosts seminars and one-on-one retreats with people around the world, integrating transformational dances, theater performances, and other creative arts into daily routines. She inspires others to break away from their comfort zones, play in nature, and awaken hidden passions.

results.description:
Have you ever felt like no matter how hard you work you just can't seem to get ahead financially?

Have you ever felt unappreciated or underpaid by your boss or organization you work for?

Have you ever felt powerless with your financial future like it seems so hard to make & save alot of money & often when you do it seems to disappear as fast as it came?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, a life where you work because you choose to NOT because you have to?

A life where you make a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you love or are passionate about?

If you answered yes to any or all of the above questions then this group is definitely for you! I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time constantly struggle financially & get caught up in what I call "the rat race", a race where everyone seems to be competing against each other just to get by & even worse not enjoying or feeling good about where they work.

The purpose of this group is to understand the mystery of why some people seem to attract lots of money into their lives so easily & then others seem to always be caught up in a pattern of wanting more but not getting it or at least as fast as they'd like. You'll become aware of why you are where you are financially and how you can literally shift your existing energetic/vibrational patterns so you can attract financial abundance & start living the life you've always dreamed of!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the inside secrets where you'll become aware of the most amazing discovery. You'll learn about your own money blueprint & how you literally have the power to change this blueprint pattern to support your financial abundant future that you deserve. You'll literally feel instant results from this new awareness, & the amazing techniques, tools, and processes I'll be teaching.

What gives me the right? I've spent several hundred thousand dollars in money, time, and travel learning from the best of the best of the world's luminaries, Tony Robbins, T Harv Eker, so many more. Through reading/listening to thousands of books/CDs, attending over 100 seminars/workshop intensives, & my personal insights, I finally fully understand the ultimate secret. I can't wait to share these secrets with you.

Are you ready to learn the most amazing, powerful secrets to attracting an abundance of wealth into your life now?

Don't you deserve a life of Financial Freedom, Success, & Passion on your terms?

Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life!

I'm SO excited to share these life changing secrets and look forward to meeting all who attend.

results.description:
Welcome to the Microsoft Mobile App Devs of New York City Meetup! (#MMADNYC)

Our MISSION:
To bring together developers who are building mobile apps and games on the Windows platform. Starting with Windows & Windows Phone 8.1 today, and moving to Windows 10 over the next few months, our goal is to help you get everything you need to design, build & publish apps and games, and turn them into successful ventures.

Each month Microsoft hosts presentations and workshops for App and Game developers at the Microsoft Times Square office, led by our team of Technical Evangelists. We welcome all levels of coders - professionals and students - and we are committed to helping developers be successful with their smartphone and tablet apps.

What we cover:

Anything that has to do with building a Windows Phone or Windows 8.x app: deep dives into app models, specific SDKs, libraries, tips & tricks, etc.

Game development for the Windows Platform using Unity, GameMaker, Construct2, XNA/MonoGame, C++/DirectX, etc.

Microsoft Cloud for app developers, Azure Mobile Services, back-end data stores, Dev Ops, etc.

Publishing your apps & games in the store, App Monetization, Advertising & Marketing.

Windows platform apps and the Internet of Things (IoT), and also Kinect & HoloLens.

All members who attend the monthly Meetup can win raffle prizes from our sponsors such as Xbox games, books on mobile development from O'Reilly and Microsoft Press. Members also get access to other sponsor discounts and exclusive offers for possible beta programs or insider programs. We typically meet on the fourth Tuesday evening of every month at the Microsoft office in Times Square. We also host special sessions, roundtables, office hours and workshops to provide technical assistance with building your apps.

While this group primarily targets app and game development on the Windows Universal App Platform, we also cover cross-platform technologies - such as Xamarin or Cordova - that let developers target more than one mobile platform.

Make sure to join us and RSVP for our upcoming meetings and events.
results.name: Microsoft Mobile App Devs of New York City (#MMADNYC)

results.description:
This group is being formed to help people with diabetes manage the daily challenges that come with this chronic illness. Through both a psychotherapeutic and educational approach members will grow and learn better ways to manage their diabetes, both physically and emotionally.


As a group member you will:

• Be assisted in managing emotional instability and mood swings from low and high blood glucose.

• Learn how to identify whether your mood is based on your environment, relationships with others, or blood glucose levels including highs, lows and shifting blood sugars.

• Understand and utilize techniques discussed in groups to improve relationship issues between diabetes and oneself, parents, family, spouses, friends and business colleagues.

• Discover the impact diabetes plays or has played in the group members’ lives which leads to a happier and healthier you.

• Learn new coping mechanisms to deal with the emotional factors that comes with living with diabetes.

• Debunk self-blame and learn why some behaviors you have may or may not be caused by the physical aspects of diabetes and not you, the person.

• Address emotional issues during Group therapy sessions that are often overlooked or remain unattended to by other health professionals. Feelings of isolation, depression, anger, loss and others become detrimental to healthy living and increase the risk of mismanaging diabetes.

 

Benefits of attending a group:

  • Increase self-esteem and self-confidence.
  • Improve communication skills.
  • Enhance your feelings of connectedness to others.
  • Increase your ability to manage diabetes
  • Learn from others’ to help better manage your diabetic life.
  • Improved physical health

 

Eliot LeBow, LCSW, CDE

Individual, Couple, Family & Group Talk-Therapist

323 West 96th Street, Suite 2B, NYC

www.therapyhelp.com
results.name: Group Therapy for NYC Diabetics

results.description:
Take a moment to get to know us:

The idea behind this meetup is to provide a convenient spot off of the Brooklyn ended N&R Train for people to meet and make new friends. It's also intended to be a somewhat low key thing with only couple dozen people. That way you're sure to actually be included in the conversation.

We have a RSPV limit to most places we meet. If you RSVP, try and show up. If you change your mind try and change your RSVP too. It isn't a huge issue but if you occupy a spot you're also potentially preventing others from coming out.

This group ins't run by a club promoter or anyone looking to make a random buck. If you're familiar with other groups in NYC, it can be pretty annoying to see RSVPs showing 4 actual poeple and a head count of 200. It also can be annoying to see a 25$ admission fee for the privilage to purchase 10$ drinks. We are not that. That said, if you're hell bent on showing your gratitude to the organizer of the event your at, a drink for the organizer or round of shots for everyone says is all :)

Lastly, come on out and have fun! Its the name of the game.

See you there!

results.description:
Welcome to Responsive Web Design NYC!

If you are interested in a common web strategy for mobile, tablet and desktop then Responsive Web Design NYC is right for you!

This group was the first NYC Responsive Web Design Meet-up launched in Sept 2011 with the spirit of serving the design, developer, product management and business community of NYC around all topics pertaining to Responsive Web Design.  Anyone from the community can organize, participate and run an event!  We are very fortunate to have great sponsors that will help with venues and refreshments!

Responsive Web Design (RWD) is essentially a web design process leveraging W3C CSS3 media queries with fluid proportion-based grids, to adapt the layout to the viewing environment, and probably also including flexible images. As a result, users across a broad range of devices and browsers will have access to a single source of content, laid out so as to be easy to read and navigate with a minimum of re-sizing, panning and scrolling.

Some Key Topics ( and we can cater to yours as well!)

  • Learning the basics and essentials of RWD
  • Learning from different experts about the designs they have implemented     (CASE STUDIES)
  • Deep discussions around the RWD process
  • Monetization techniques of RWD
  • Technical review of tools and frameworks such as SASS/COMPASS
  • And anything the group proposes.....

The style of the meet-up is very participatory with each meet-up catering to the requests of the group for the next meet-up!

If you are interested in being a co-organizer, that would be great!

Thanks for joining!

RWDNYC

PS- Visit our Facebook page for industry news, latest site releases on Responsive Web Design!

https://www.facebook.com/ResponsiveWebDesignNYC?fref=ts
results.name: Responsive Web Design NYC

results.description:
Are you a queer woman and a buddhist practitioner, or interested in buddhism and meditation? Are you looking for friends and community?

QueerBuddhist Women is a group for queer, bi, trans, gay, lesbian women who are buddhist practitioners, or are interested in meditation and buddhism.

Find out about our events and sign up!  We gather for meditation, teachings, films, outings, and to make friends and socialize.  All members can schedule events.  Please take a look at some of the things we have done in the past as a rough guide for creating your own event for other QBW members.

Background: This group originated in New York City with the women who attend the QueerDharma (http://queerdharma.org/) meditation group that meets on Sundays in Manhattan.


"Keep this teaching at the heart of your practice. Wherever you are and whatever you are doing, pause from time to time and relax your mind. You don't have to change anything about your experience. You can let thoughts and feelings come and go freely, and leave your senses wide open. Make friends with your experience and see if you can notice the spacious awareness that is with you all the time. Everything you ever wanted is right here in this present moment of awareness." Mingyur Rinpoche
results.name: QueerBuddhist Women

Welcome to Lady Runners! 

Do you want to run a 5k, 10k, or Marathon?  Do you want to stay motivated and get fit? Do you want to share your passion for running with others? If so, you have found the right group!

Lady Runners is a group that welcomes all runners. We are runners of all paces from beginner to advanced. Our group is about sharing camaraderie, having fun, losing weight, and improving our fitness.  No one is left behind - we all start together but we go at our own pace.  Someone will always be there at the end to greet the last runner or finish the run with you. We also support and cheer each other on at races and while training. We have scheduled weekly runs, posted races, and other fun activities like cycling, yoga, brunch, or we are open to suggestions.

Experience is not necessary - just the willingness to run, have fun and make friends. This is a great group for those who might be looking for that extra motivation to get started!

results.description:
Maybe you moved to New York to sing professionally, and somewhere along the way you forgot how to have fun. Maybe you sing strictly in the privacy of your own shower, and you'd like to find out how much fun it can be to sing in front of others. There aren't a lot of places where it's okay to sing just for fun! In our meetups, we gather in a rehearsal space in Manhattan with an accompanist, and we take turns getting up in front of each other and singing just for the joy of it.  Broadway, opera, pop, jazz... it's all fair game.  No critiques, no feedback (except monstrous applause for each and every singer) and no feeling awful because you didn't hit the high note the way you wanted to. (By the way, the more joy you find in your singing, the more often you WILL hit that high note beautifully and precisely.) Come have some fun with us!

 

Next Meetup:

Date: October 23rd 2011, 7pm
results.name: Sing for Joy! (New York)

results.description:
Hi All,

A lovely woman named Zoe first organized this group & I joined it right away. Soon after that she announced that she stepped down due to some nasty emails. I had already read the intros of other members & felt such kinship that I stepped up as organizer.

I think with membership recently passing the 200 mark, I've got more than adequate support for any negativity even if I am not a "tough New Yorker." I'm not even a New Yorker. In fact, since stepping up, I have not received a single negative from anybody about this group.

I post meetups largely based on what I love to do. I support tried-&-true performers & venues I am proud to endorse & promote.

I also am happy to post events you suggest & are committed to attending yourself so you can be the event host. Feel free to call me with ideas or just to say Hi. My # is 646-884-0505.  Or, simply email me & I will make sure the description is posted after I confirm details.

Our next big event: the premiere "I'm Not Sure I Belong Here Talent Show." Oct 8 is the meetup with the talent show talent to plan the talent show. (Eh?) Join us!

Cheers,

Janelle

results.description:
Habit Design® is the largest crowdsourced training community sharing best practices in developing sustainable daily habits that last beyond 100 days. Our goal is to spawn local "habit labs" across the world; over 100,000 members have participated representing 500+ companies, universities, non-profits, and other organizations.

We synthesize applied research across a wide range of habit designers including entrepreneurs, Wellness companies & professionals, non-profits, trainers, coaches, academics, and everyday enthusiasts. Some methods, tools, & frameworks we've covered include Behavior-Change Psychology, Captology (Persuasive Technology), Game Mechanics & Techniques, Behavioral Economics, Sociology, etc.

Colleagues that have shared their research with us include Dr. BJ Fogg, Leo Babauta (Zenhabits.net), New York Times reporter Charles Duhigg (author of "The Power of Habit"), Gretchen Rubin (author "The Happiness Project"), Dr. David Sobel (Kaiser Permanente), Dr. Kelly McGonigal (author, "The Willpower Instinct"), Dr. Peter Gollwitzer (Head, NYU Motivation Lab), and many others. By integrating these crowdsourced best-practices, we advance innovation in our community.

Habit Design was founded by @michaelbkim. Corporate partnerships are welcome: for more information contact michael@habitdesign.org.

LINKS:

Homepage: http://www.habitdesign.org

Selected past talks: http://vimeo.com/channels/habitdesign

Michael Kim: http://www.about.me/michaelkim
results.name: Habit Design® NYC

results.description:
Welcome! This group is for Russian-speaking parents of New Jersey, who want to meet other families and foster a community where their children can socialize in Russian, enjoy Russian holidays and traditions together, and simply have fun! Our goals are dual: to help our kids communicate in Russian in varied and enjoyable ways, and also for us, parents, to connect with other Russian parents in the area and share useful information.

Originally founded in September 2011 in Jersey City, we pride ourselves on doing everything on a volunteer basis, with our own hands and heads, and for the well being of our children. Anyone can be a member or an organizer and everyone's ideas are welcomed.

We meet anywhere members choose- in the parks, during events, at people's homes, etc. Meetups include a variety of activities, ranging from just getting together on a playground to attending cultural events to organizing holidays and picnics for  large groups of parents and kids. All members are encouraged to create meetups at a place and time convenient for them!

This meetup is for parents with at least one child younger than 10 years old. Parents who live outside of New Jersey are welcome, but they must be able to attend meetups. Again, please don't hesitate to make your own meetups! Please see "Pages" for more information.

This is not a public meetup, and members must be approved by an Organizer in order to join. Please fill out a profile with a photograph of yourself. We encourage active participation.

Thank you!

topics.name: How to Maintain your Natural Hair in Winter Time
Keeping a Professional Image with Natural Hair

results.description:
Growing up it was not okay not to be processed in some way, relaxer, straightening comb, jerry curl, texturizer, etc. After that it was not okay to be without extensions, braids, weaves and wigs. It is okay to be relaxed, it is okay to wear weaves, it is okay to wear wigs and it is also okay to wear your own hair.  Natural hair is okay and beautiful. 

I have learned so much and in learning to care and maintain my hair I find that I am also more aware of my health, the food that I eat, the need for exercise and vitamins. After all what comes out the body is based on what goes in. My eyes opened to the world that I'd stepped into where I saw all kinds of natural hair styles, natural women, natural hair care products, natural hair care books and more.

So after much consideration, this group, the Natural Hair Group of NJ & NY, was started for other naturals in NJ, NY and the Tri-State area to meet, share and support.

results.description:
This meetup group has been started because of the challenges I've had of finding Pathfinder and D&D v3.5 players around that are my own age. I know you're out there and are busy with your professional lives and perhaps you have family obligations as I do. The purpose of this group is to initially meet for a bimonthly game of Pathfinder and to escape from reality a couple times a month. I've had the books for two years now & I've kept putting off this group because other things just keep coming up. That's life, right? It's now or never. I believe the bimonthly meetup will allow greater flexibility in the beginning. This group is for players that are 30 years old and up so if you don't make the requirement please don't ask to be a member of the group.  If you are interested in a group that plays by the rules although bends them at times (who has time or the patience to keep track of how much you're carrying or your rations in the game although what player could carry 5 suits of full plate anyway?) then this is the group for you. The group will not simply be a hack and slash type of group although I'm sure there will be lots of encounters and melee. If you want a primarily hack and slash type of play then join a MMO game or a younger D&D v4.0 group so you don't waste our time or yours.  I find the most efficient use of time is to utilize modules and some creativity. The groups I have most enjoyed in the past usually rotated with a different person hosting each game at their home. Having said all this I do want to add that I am a very open minded gamer and I still am learning the Pathfinder game myself although I believe my experience with v3.5 of D&D has helped prep me for this. 

 

If you don't meet the age requirements (30 y.o.) then I'd recommend looking at some of the local gamestores as well as other message boards.  Best to you in your endeavors.
results.name: Pathfinder Dungeons and Dragons version 3.5 RPG Meetup

results.description:
Do you long for ways to live a more wholesome existence? Are you attracted to the idea of a more sustainable lifestyle while connecting with people who care about the same?

Now is a great time to start creating the homestead you dream of.  Now is a great time to connect with a community of people who are interested in sharing their successes, sharing their skill, and sharing their joy of the same.

The place to start your homestead is where you live right now! You can start right now, be it a 100 acre farm or a studio apartment in the city.  It matters not how much you do but what your intentions are, and if you're here... you are most likely a kindred spirit.

 

Homesteading at Home is where we will connect with like-minded people who share an interest in sustainable, self-sufficient living.

Our focus will be on all things connected with starting, maintaining, and growing our homestead including:

  • Growing and preserving our own food
  • Making home-brew beer and wine
  • Clean energy alternatives
  • Animal husbandry including backyard chickens
  • Beekeeping
  • Healthy eating
  • Off the grid living
  • Permaculture
  • Fermented foods
  • Green building
  • Organic gardening
  • Appreciation of nature through art and music
  • Traditional American skills
  • Emergency preparedness
  • Repair, Reuse, and Recycling
  • Composting
  • Foraging
  • Teaching our friends, family, and children about sustainability
  • Reduction of waste
  • Soapmaking
  • Blacksmithing
  • Seed Saving
  • Fuel efficiency
  • Aquaculture
  • Traditional crafts
  • Woodworking
  • and much, much more...

 

We will change, grow, and adapt, as our individual homesteads will as well.  However, we will be connected through community and share our successes, share our skills, and share our harvests too!!

We should expect to meet regularly in a friendly setting to discuss topics, share resources, and perhaps learn a thing or two from one another. We will also share meetups at related events throughout the area on topics of interest.

Please feel free to introduce youself when you join and tell us just a little about why you're here.

Welcome!
results.name: Homesteading at Home

results.description:
The HTML5 developers group is for people to get together and talk about how we’re starting to build applications using HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript. It’s intended for both traditional front-end developers moving from websites to the larger world of web applications, as well as native/rich internet application developers who are looking to transfer their skills to these up-and-coming technologies.

There are already great HTML5 and JavaScript groups in New York so we're hoping to do something a little different. Instead of a single large presentation per event, we'll be trying to do one 30–45 minute and two or three 10 minute lightning talks. The intention is that events will be a lot less formal and will encourage attendees to share their thoughts and experience with the rest of the group.

We'll try to mix up talks every event so they'll be content for both people approaching the platform and for experienced front-end engineers wondering how traditional techniques such as design patterns and tools make sense in this brave new JavaScript world.

We're only just getting started, so if you have any thoughts or suggestions please get in touch. Also, if you're interesting in sponsoring the group in any capacity, we'd love to hear from you.
results.name: NYCHTML5

results.description:
The first Cafe Philosophique was founded in Paris in 1992, at the Cafe des Phares in Place de la Bastille, as an informal, public forum for philosophical discussion. There are now over 150 "Cafe Philos" active around the world.

Cafe Philo New York was established in 1998 by Bernard Roy, Associate Professor of Philosophy at Ramapo College, NJ. We gather twice a month on Thursday evenings in the private room of an Afghan Restaurant in East Midtown Manhattan to talk about the philosophical implications of a particular topic. Topics are selected by group vote at the end of each meeting.

Discussions are informal, friendly, and lightly moderated. We welcome those with some background in philosophy, as well as anyone with curiosity, a thoughtful disposition, and consideration for the ideas of others. Attendance has ranged from 5 to 25 "Philistes." While there is no fee, the restaurant requests, understandably, that attendees spend a $5.00 "minimum per" for food and/or drinks.
results.name: Cafe Philo New York

results.description:
The Four Noble Truths are not any religion at all. They are a methodology: 1. to understand the problem; 2. to realize the origination of the problem; 3. to cease the problem only if the origination of the problem is ceased; 4. to establish the procedure and path to cease the origination of the problem; 5. to practice the right path to cease the problem; 6. to liberate from the problem.

Let's explore the original teachings of the historical Buddha Sakyamuni based on the Suttas (or Sutras) from oral transmissions in the first Buddhist Council -- three rounds & twelve aspects of the Four Noble Truths and the Seven Factors of Awakening (see Files under "More" menu).  It is called the middle-path or the one-path (Ekāyana = Eka + ayana) for Enlightenment.

In contrast to other traditions, Original Buddhism relies exclusively on the core teachings of Siddhartha Gautama, the founder of Buddhism. For the purpose of comparison, our closest mainstream tradition is Theravada. The scriptures that we normally study are Samyutta-Nikaya, Majjhima-Nikaya, Digha-Nikaya and Angutara-Nikaya.

To cherish lives and our environment, let's practice to be vegetarians.  To benefit our community, let's develop the four bonds of fellowship "generosity, kind words, beneficial help, consistency" (cf. AN.4.32).

There are no formal prerequisites and the classes are free. We welcome participants regardless of experience, who are willing to make the commitment. All students will be expected to arrive on time, attend complete sessions, and while at the temple, observe Buddhist customs. For information on Original Buddhism, please visit http://www.arahant.org/. For further details on the study, the group's organizer can be reached at 917-916-0091.

Those who wants to study and compare the Suttas of the four main Pali Nikayas online and their counterparts in various languages, please refer to the Online Sutta Correspondence Project at http://www.suttacentral.net/

For Suttas in German, please refer to http://palikanon.com/

For Suttas in Spanish, please refer to http://www.bosquetheravada.org/

Audio material: Karma of fatalism versus and karma of Relevant Influencing (spoken in Chinese; translation in English)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NOMaFuwoLZw
results.name: Buddhism of Four Noble Truths

results.description:
There's an incredible transformation taking place in Medicine right now, and this group is focused on the design, development and implementation of innovation -- technologic, systems and operational -- directly at healthcare professionals.  And we want to create a community that is in the lead!

The current roles and responsibilities, interdependencies and ways of working  between physicians, nurses, pharmacists and other healthcare professionals are being challenged and there will need to be careful consideration of the way software, systems, products and services are designed in support of optimizing interactions towards patient care.  We also want to help healthcare professionals who want to be entrepreneurs and help medical innovators get into the market.

This Meetup will facilitate innovation-generating activities, explore new frameworks for product design, and support innovation activities among its members.  We will examine issues such as interaction design in professional workflow, user experience management in health care delivery, social network analysis to learn about HCP working relationships, ommunication, collaboration, cooperation and control.

As for me, I'm Nancy Lin, stay-at-home mother of my 4 yr old son Milo, and the author of:

results.description:
What is Ameripon?

We are a Japanese-English language exchange group with a focus on conversation practice. Our group is aimed toward intermediate/advanced learners looking to improve fluency and ability to discuss various topics beyond the basics of "Nice weather we're having today/今日はいい天気ですね"

During each meet-up, we speak only Japanese half the time, and then only English the other half. Conversation topics will be chosen beforehand and posted in each event description--members are encouraged to prepare by learning more about the talking points beforehand. The more thoughts you can share, the better our conversation practice will become!

Language exchange meet-ups will be held bi-monthly on Sunday afternoons at Sony Plaza (550 Madison Ave). We also plan on hosting fun outings in between language meetups--things like ordering in Japanese at an izakaya, or in English at a steakhouse; or watching Japanese/English movies; or visiting Japan society; or catching a Yankees game. Ultimately, we want to bring YOU the best of Japanese and American culture in New York (and a rip-snortin' good time, too!)

And check us out on Facebook, where you'll find recaps of our events and bi-lingual conversations about anything! 

Ultimately, we want to provide our members with 1) Japanese & English conversation practice, 2) Japanese & American culture exchange, and 3) a Japanese & American community in NY for friends, networking, and support.

We can't wait to meet and practice Japanese & English with all of you. よろしく！
results.name: Ameripon

topics.name: Children of Divorce and Changing Families

results.description:
Are you the Targeted Parent  or the Targeted Family of Parental Alienation?  If so, you may be confused, hurt, sad, frustrated, angry, ashamed, embarrassed, and simply long for the alienated child, however young or old, back in your life.  Parental Alienation is gender-neutral and effects both Mothers and Fathers, as well as Step-Parents, Siblings, Grandparents, Aunts and Uncles, and anyone who loves a child who is being turned against them.  Sadly, the consequences of Parental Alienation are undeniably the most detrimental to the Children who are the pawns of the Alienator.

We are a peer-led support group of individuals who have experienced, and still are experiencing, the effects of divorce and Parental Alienation.  The purpose of this group is to provide a judgement-free atmosphere for discussion, support, and encouragement to heal on a personal level, and to provide education and increase public awareness about the damaging effects of Parental Alienation.  Our goal is to help families navigate divorce and beyond in a peaceful, conscious and loving manner.

Despite where we are on our journey through life, and however we are experiencing Parental Alienation let us gather together in order grow and heal and come to a deeper understanding of our situation in a positive manner.

Children NEED both parents.  Children DESERVE both parents.  Children have a RIGHT to BE LOVED and to GIVE LOVE to both parents.

Parental Alienation IS Child Abuse.

 

Contact us at ParentalAlienationNJ@gmail.com
results.name: Parental Alienation Support and Awareness NJ

results.description:
Bienvenue !

We are lovers of French language, French culture, customs, traditions as well as its history and diversity.

Created a couple of years ago, we are already the biggest French meetup in the USA :-)

We organize several events a week :

- French Mondays to meet and greet, improve our French conversation skils, and make new connections.

- Wednesdays, we have a weekly French FREE workshop.

- Thursdays, we like to have a special French Moroccan evening with belly dancers, happy hour specials, hookahs etc.

- Weekends, we meet in great night life venues such as SkyRoom or Cellar Bar with free admission for our members.

We promote writers, artists, philosophers and food lovers. We also love people who want to talk about areas with strong cultural Francophonie roots, our members are French, Canadian, North and West African, Haitian, Swiss, Belgium and of course American people who like everything French.

Although the official language is French, you do NOT need to speak French to be a member, we will just ask you to be patient with our accent if we try to communicate. Each event has a theme and ideas are welcome.

-- Jean-Philippe, founder
results.name: ! French New York City !

results.description: This meetup group Participants will be guided in physical Yoga, Yogic breathing exercises or called Pranayama (breath exercises) free of charge along with meditations which are holistic self healing tools that regulate the nervous system. We all must have heard of meditation, but meditation does not starts without a target to focus upon, and therefore the great yogis of India and Himalayas use to open the third eye or agya chakras of the practitioners for them to see the light within them and be able to focus upon the light & breath in order to control the mind and thoughts along with training the mind to response calmly during stressful situations and for them to be able to regulate the nervous system which is responsible to health and wellbeing of endocrine system etc. This group will help you live a balance, more fulfilled and content life, despite the external situations in the world as the source of your joy and peace would be from within you. Anyone can join the group regardless of color, nationality, gender, faith etc. who is looking for self help method and improve the quality of their life.
results.name: Meditation & yogic breathing for healthy & stress free you!

results.description:
It's all about the L-O-V-E....

This group promotes a love for the straight-ahead, be-bop style that was born in the early to mid-20th century. Join us & help move this beautiful, "distinctively American art form" into the 21st Century by performing the material &/or showing love for those who do.

With this meetup group, I aim to promote my own performances & those of other straight-ahead jazz musical artists.

Some of them are here in NYC;
 some are on the other side of the world.
Some I've worked with & become friends with;
some I never will (mainly because they're no longer with us);
some I look forward to meeting one day.

No matter what, I will inform this group's members of great jazz performances coming to venues near them, & thus encourage that old-fashioned thing called "hanging out" in a face-to-face, flesh-&-blood way. That is what meetup.com is all about!

I love this company, meetup.com, & am so grateful for the founders' wise, proactive & life-giving response to 9/11 through the creation of this amazing system.

PS
 Please note that while smooth jazz, fusion, open, "new age" & other modern styles have made & continue to make their invaluable marks in musical history, there are other meetup groups that are a better fit for those fans. This group focuses on straight ahead & be bop. Period. Don't you just love those songs that are so under-represented worldwide & deserve our support if not efforts aiming for a full-on revival! Sounds fun, yes?

results.description: NYLUG.org is New York's Linux Users Group supporting all things Linux and Open Source in the greater New York area. Meetings are free and open to the public (RSVP usually required). Meetings will usually (but not always) take place the second Thursday of the month starting at 6:30pm. Meetings are announced on the NYLUG-Announce mailing list as soon as they are scheduled. All meetings are free and open to the public, but you should put yourself on the RSVP list for your convenience and ours. Our programming Workshop takes place every other Tuesday at the NY Public Library, Hudson Park Branch. You can see the schedule here by checking its calendar. Please, feel free to contact us at info@nylug.org, if you have any questions about NYLUG.org.

results.description:
Congregation Beit Simchat Torah (CBST) is a vibrant spiritual community and a progressive voice within Judaism. Founded in 1973, CBST attracts and welcomes gay men, lesbians, bisexuals, transgender, queer and straight individuals and families who share common values. Passionate, provocative, and deeply Jewish, CBST champions a Judaism that rejoices in diversity, denounces social injustice wherever it exists, and strives for human rights for all people.

Join others in their 40s and 50s for fun events with a focus on providing an opportunity to connect with members of the CBST community. From guided tours of historic Jewish neighborhoods, to ice skating and brunch out. The 40s/50s group is always looking for input in event planning and would love to have you join us this year at our events. We are for couples and singles, members and non-members, all genders and orientations. Are events are open to all and the age range in our name should be seen as a guide not a rule.

results.description:
NYCC (New York Culture Club) is a social and educational cultural studies organization. Essentially we are a combination book club / cultural immersion group. Our goal is to embrace and appreciate the diversity of our world, and the people within it, while engaging in a social and entertaining experience that take us around globe via the city of New York.

PLEASE FOLLOW US:

http://www.facebook.com/NYCultureClub

https://twitter.com/nycultureclub

HOW IT WORKS:

Every quarter we choose a country or culture and create a program of relevant and accessible activities. The group meets approximately every three weeks and the meetings will range from general discussions, guest speakers, documentaries, trips to museum, dance lessons, festivals, tours, cultural events, etc. Often we will meet in a restaurant to experience the cuisine and field trips are a big part of the experience.

Everyone is encouraged to choose a book about that country that corresponds to their particular area of interest and to learn as much as they can during the timeframe. The book(s) you choose can be anything from ancient history to current events, fiction or non, cookbooks to textile design. Basically, we want everyone to get excited about some aspect of the culture and to share that knowledge with the rest of the group.

Coming up soon: Zimbabwe, Brazil, Korea, Ukraine.

We are typically a smallish group and prefer people who are dedicated to taking part in most of our events, rather than people who only occasionally attend. This is not a sit-back experience, but an opportunity to be fully engaged and participatory, including taking on responsibility for contributions and organization. There are fees for individual events as necessary.

If this sounds interesting to you, then please apply for membership. We will read the answers to your application questions seriously, and will select individuals based on their willingness to fully participate and add to the knowledge base of the group.

Thanks for your interest & we look forward to hearing from you!!
results.name: NY Culture Club

results.description:
When you come to West Side Talkers, You Don't Just Get A Toastmasters Public Speaking Club, You get An Experience!

 

At West Side Talkers You get A One-Stop-Shop For All Your Public Speaking Needs.

Our comprehensive program at West Side Talkers is designed to help you develop your public speaking skills, more quickly and efficiently. - And all this while having Fun! Here is a quick snapshot of what we do at West Side Talkers that is an enhancement of our Toastmasters program. (No other Toastmasters club typically includes this in their program.)

1. Public Speaking Tip of The Day:

Our public speaking tip is given by Lewis Roth who is the founder of our club and is also a Certified World Class Public Speaking Coach. In this segment you will discover new speaking tips that you can immediately implement in your very next speech.

2. Commercial Minute:

This part of our program helps you develop your 60 second "elevator speech." As a former member of a renowned professional networking group, Lewis Roth has created over 100 unique 60 second commercials for his business. At West Side Talkers You get to learn from a World Class Speaker and coach on how to create your very own unique 60 second commercials.

3. Improv Comedy:

This is one of the hottest parts of our club meeting! As  advanced improvisers, Lewis Roth and Sam Higgins bring their experience from the world of theater to help you develop your spontaneity, your emotions and characterization to help you become a public speaker that captivates and engages their audience. We actually do "real" improv at our club meetings!

The three items listed above, you will not typically find at any other Toastmasters Club. At West Side Talkers we do everything that the Toastmasters program has to offer: (Prepared Speeches, Evaluations, Table Topics, Word of the Day and more.) But we don't stop there, we go above and beyond!

Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!
results.name: West Side Talkers Toastmasters

results.description:
Why I started this Group:

After spending most of my professional life working for some of the largest U.S. corporations, I realized a disturbing fact, companies today are not only laying off an unprecedented amount of older workers but they are also not hiring them. With many of their savings and retirement accounts wiped out due to the current recession, this group has been hung out to dry in the job seeking process. Even worse, the process of finding a job has dramatically changed from applying in person to applying online--where older job seekers are up against thousands of tech savvy young college graduates. Recently unemployed myself, I came to the realization that the 40 and up age group just doesn't get the attention it needs and deserves. I felt that it was time for me to do something about it and make a real difference.

Purpose:

The purpose of this group is to join together and support the unemployed and employed job seekers over 40 who have been negatively impacted by this economy. We want to be the largest Over 40 job networking group in New York City, and eventually the country. This group will meet on a regular basis (monthly or quarterly) to network, share personal stories, and share career advice. Most importantly, we will have fun!!! This group will be open to suggestions by any of its members on where and when to meet.

Who Should Join:

Although this group is open to all ages who want to provide support, we encourage all 40 and up job seekers (employed or unemployed) who have been displaced by today's economy to join. This group also welcomes all job providers who believe they can offer job opportunities or advice.

 

**Please visit our sponsor's website at 40ForHire.com to preview what is being developed to make our lives easier. You can also sign-up for their Private Beta program now at the following link: SIGN-UP
results.name: NYC Career Networking Over 40

results.description:
Day Seized is a group that serves to help young professionals escape the office and seize the day by meeting awesome new people and going on exciting adventures, trips, and events.

 

Here's how it works: We will meet a few times a month after work to chat about possible trips people would love to take as well as simply meet new people over drinks. Additionally, there will be a several adventure trips, usually on weekends, where we will go on some social adventures such as kayacking, skiing, zip lining, rock climbing and whatever else you guys are excited to do.

 

So come out to our next event to meet great people and go on some amazing adventures.

 

Carpe Diem!

 

1. Discover adventure stories on our blog Day Seized Adventures

2. Explore adventure videos and pictures on our Day Seized Facebook Page

3. Follow adventure tips and ideas on our Day Seized Twitter

 

Hike Legend(ary)

Hikes will be rated on a 3 tiered difficulty level:

Easy- These hikes will be mostly flat with at most 1 or 2 small climbs. We will wait for people to catch up and go at a nice easy pace. Sneakers are fine. Most people should have no issue on these.

Moderate- These hikes will be a mix of hills and flats. We will go at a moderate pace. Sneakers are fine but hiking boots would be ideal. If you get winded walking up the stairs in the morning this might be an issue but as long as you're in decent shape you should be fine.

Advanced- These hikes will involve lots of hills and create a nice challenge for those more seasoned hikers. We will go at moderate pace. Hiking boots are recommended. Only the fittest of them should join.
results.name: Day Seized Adventures- NYC

results.description:
This is a group is for all of us who have lost someone or something important in our lives -- whether through death or separation, and whether a person, a pet, a job, a house, or anything else. We will get together to talk about the loss as well as to do meditations, simple artwork, and other activities to help us process this experience. I've had several major losses in my life and know what it's like, too.

 

Some workshops will be run by a licensed psychotherapist, Jane Dorlester, LCSW. She is a bereavement specialist and does both group and one-on-one sessions. This meetup, if you choose, it can be the starting point to a 6-week group that will help members express, understand, and work through their grief by learning coping mechanisms and connecting with other members for support. However, each meetup is a complete experience on its own as well. We will talk about our loved ones, learn some skills, and do activities such as meditations to help us all heal together.
results.name: Brooklyn Bereavement & Grief Support Group
